Even at the bar, there was no bartender and the waitress was running around like a chicken with her head cut off. But instead of speaking to them with a "threatening" tone like the below reviewer did, we waited...

Finally, DUE TO OUR PATIENCE AND KINDNESS FOR HUMANITY (instead of being a complete self-entitled jerk to people who are just doing their jobs), we were seated at a table upstairs. It was now 9PM. An hour wait on Cinco De Mayo from the time we got there is NOT bad at all. Plus, this place is BYO so we had tequila shots to hold us over. Not to mention the chips and salsa they immediately served us upon sitting at the bar. 

We ordered our food right away and our pitchers of margs. 

The food alone was so worth the wait and I genuinely pity those that left this restaurant in anger and impatience because dude, you missed out! 

The Carne Asada tacos were BOMB! Empanadas were prob the best I've ever had and their Queso dip was so cheesy and delicious that my mouth is watering all over again thinking about it. My friends had the shrimp tacos, Pastor tacos and my husband had the Chorizo Burrito (which was as big as my head!) All soooo delicious!

Where this establishment lacked in service, the food clearly made up for it. Could/should they have been more prepared? ABSOLUTELY. No arguments there but I truly felt bad for them that night. People were yelling and screaming for a table, their food and the waitresses were doing their best! They clearly never had a rush like this before but they made up for it. 

When the bill came, they comped us an appetizer and our two pitchers of margs for being so patient with them. And for the reviewers that called this place expensive..a taco order that comes with 3 tacos was $8....you pay more at a food truck, bruh. 

Our waitress was so sweet, frazzled, but you could see in her face how upset she was for not being able to cater to everyones needs the way she wanted. Adam, whom I am assuming is a bus boy?, took control and was the one who seated us at the bar, gave us chips and salsa to hold us over, tracked down our waitress, got us our table and then gave us grubhub coupons as an apology. If this kid is not on the wait staff, he should be! He's the reason why we didn't mind being so patient. 

All in all, the food was amazing and you shouldn't write this place off from one terrible experience on the busiest night of the year for them. Compassion and humanity go a long way, especially when your nice to those that handle your food!

Came across this place after a night out in NoLibz. They had a great deal featured on Groupon and on Yelp. They have outdoor seating, which is awesome this time of year. The service was fast and our server was so friendly. They give you chips & salsa verde as you sit down -- and let me tell you, that salsa was amazing! We ended up ordering guacamole (delicious), Arrachera, 2 Mexican Coffees and fried ice cream. Everything was great. I highly recommend going here, and I will definitely be stopping by again! Don't forget to buy a Groupon or check in on yelp to uncover some deals before checking it out.

My date was in the mood for Mexican.  I've been to Dos Segundos before and although it is more prototypically what you visualize for American Mexican it was not what I was in the mood for.    I also considered El Camino Real but, once again, not quite what I was after.  I found Las Cazuelas and it was well reviewed plus it was BYO.  It seemed well reviewed so I was looking forward to it.

We brought a bottle and we showed up.  It is a nice, small, one room place with a pleasant staff.  They were proud of their Mole sauce so that is what I ordered, over chicken.  My date had the vegetable enchiladas.  We both cleaned our plates.  The food was pretty good.

I will say this.  Based on the address I was expecting maybe more of a hole in the wall taqueria than a kind of fancy $20 entree place.  The truth is that is what I was looking for so I was disappointed but I did feel that I got my $50 worth.

Now that I know what to expect I would definitely return.

We love this restaurant.  We've been going there since it opened many years ago.
This time we brought 2 people for their first visit.  They said it was the best Mexican
food they ever had.
I had coconut shrimp this time and it was delicious.  My husband had red snappef filet and said it was superb.
This time they offered chocolate tres leches.  It was to die for.  Their regular one is also amazing, but the chocolate was a real treat.
Awesome place, been here multiple times, everytime is excellent. Also BYOB!

We've now been to this place 3 times. The Groupon deal makes it a bargain. The $16 ribeye dinner is good and the steak properly cooked to order. Also had the pulled pork with rice and beans- a good hearty meal. The homemade guac and homemade chips is a great app while waiting for dinner. BYO for not only tequila but for beer- my choice with good Mexican food. Servers are friendly, place is small but we've never had to wait too long for a table. We had the mole chicken on one visit and although I can believe it's authentic, it is not my favorite.
The queso dip is damn good.

Best mexican food in the area.  Delicious, authentic and fresh.  We kept looking for someone's Abuela to come out of the kitchen.  Super accommodating to vegetarians - they offered to adjust meat recipes too.
Went here while it was gusting winds and rain outside (it was a rough trek there). The restaurant is small but cozy and very colorful. The food is above average for sure but so are the prices.
Awesome Mexican food place. The place is super trendy and the food is amazing. Really is a hidden gem with an outstanding menu. The service is awesome and the food is amazing.

Came here for a friend's birthday BYO couple weeks ago (with around 20 or so friends) It was a little cramped, but if you're looking for a fun BYO, this is a good option!The margaritas are great and relatively inexpensive.

On the other hand, the food is very average. I had the nachos and the empanadas.
Great food and friendly staff that went above and beyond the call of duty.  Definitely try the Tres Leche Cake when you go!

My constant need for the half star: I would give this three and a half stars.  (note: my fellow diners would have given it four).  I visited Las Cazuelas for the second time last night.  Yelp deems three stars as "A-ok" and I think that is a very fitting label for Las Cazuelas.  It is a step up from many Mexican BYO's if decor and ambiance is what you're looking for.  The space is large, with ample upstairs seating.  It is a bit pricier than some other Mexican BYO's . . . but that's because the menu is more advanced than burritos and tacos.  

We started with the queso fundido . . . as always.  This was good, standard, and enjoyable.  We also got the tacos dorados, which were also fairly standard and enjoyable.  I ordered the enchiladas with crab, which again, I found to be standard and enjoyable.  Nothing was bad; nothing was outstanding.  

It is a great place to go with a group as it does have the seating and capacity.  And they take credit cards-woohooo!

Ok want to start off by saying it's my birthday so heyyy!!! Ok went here tonight for my bday dinner I honestly can say it's ok. I heard a lot about this place and wanted to try it so the food was pretty good it has a great mixture of authentic and Tex mex but overall it wasn't bad if I lived in this neighborhood this would be my favorite Mexican spot not getaway lol....I ordered basically a carne Asada with rice and beans the steak was to die for I wish is wasn't well done because it would be a little bit better but the flavor was excellent that was my favorite dish of the night. My Bf had a burrito I believe it could have been better but it was pretty packed and he was full.   My all time favorite of the night was the dessert we shared a "tres Leche cake" I'm pretty sure that was the wrong name but Im close and I have pictures so you will see.... this cake was amazing!! It was a little dry at the top but they basically had like a homemade whipped cream for the top which was amazing and the best part was the bottom which was very moist that held the three different types of milk on the bottom. I would share the secret but I was told not too lol you just have to try it! I would say that this place can deserve five stars but they have to work on some their waitress staff so these stars I put was for my overall experience. 3 stars for the overall experience 4 stars for
The cake!
Order was wrong. Barely meat on tacos. Queso fundito was just a lump of cheese. Missed items. Insisted it was right and quality was good. Horrible customer service.

Came here with my girlfriend after getting a yelp deal and with over 130 reviews and an average of four stars I figured it was a no brainer.  Boy was I wrong, the place was empty and we were the only two people in there for the first hour it was open which is a little odd for a brunch place that seems to be quite popular and well reviewed.  The waitress was nice enough but seemed flustered which was also strange since we were her only customers, something just didn't feel right about this place.  We ordered the tamales which were gross, just a thick heavy corn batter steamed with a barely flavored cheese that resembled silly putty and didn't taste much better.  I ordered the poblano omelette which was supposed to come with roasted poblano peppers but it was basically the same omelet you can get at any diner in the world, cheese, red & green bell peppers and mushrooms but if you're paying attention you notice I didn't mention the roasted poblano because the omelette was completely devoid of it, I almost thought I by chance ordered the wrong meal because how can you honestly forget the ingredient the dish is named after, it's like ordering a fish taco but not actually getting fish in the tortilla.  I've eaten breakfast, lunch and dinner at many Mexican restaurants on both coasts and I must say this was the worst I've experienced, the food just didn't taste good nor the ingredients.  I didn't even bother to ask them to replace my meal with the proper ingredients because I feared what would come out next.  To add insult to injury I asked for some hot sauce (you know because the omelette had no flavor sans the poblano peppers) which was provided but I got charged an extra dollar for that lovely privilege.  Do yourself a favor and grab Mexican food at the myriad of other taquerias in Philly that offer a wholesome, fresh Mexican meal which is the exact opposite you can expect from this place, the one word I have for this place is gross.

Went for lunch this week and got the
empanaditas de tinga.
pros: nice quiet atmosphere (at lunch time), pleasant waiter, good
chips and salsa, good empanadas (which are only on the dinner menu, but I was allowed to order them at lunch!).

cons: waiter disappeared after serving my entre (i couldn't find anyone
to refill my water glass), menu items lacked price diversity- it was
lunch time and all I really wanted was an inexpensive burrito to fill
my belly, but everything on the menu was at least 7 bucks (and I didnt
even see burritos).

overall: I'd go back, but only if i want to eat out for dinner.

I love the food here! First I had soup, then we shared elote, both were really amazing, great flavor  I got the special fish tacos and my boyfriend got the chorizo ones and they were so good!! The menu is really extensive I can't wait to try everything else....our waitress was really nice and funny she told us the best things on the menu and accommodated our dietary restrictions.

The food is fresh and delicious; the atmosphere is casual and friendly. I have never had a meal there I didn't enjoy greatly. The guacamole is fabulous. The mains are so good--anything with mole is especially tasty--and the Three Milk Cake, despite having had various iterations over the years, has always been just scrumptious. Do finish with Mexican coffee to go with it, though the hot chocolate is marvellous as well.

This restaurant is a lot of fun! It is actually really nice inside and the service is great. If you bring your own tequila, you can get a pitcher of margaritas for $8 (free if you check in on yelp)! The margarita pitcher was really big and enough for four people to have two-three large glasses. Aside from the margarita pitcher, my table opted to share two order of guac between the four of us. Chips were unlimited and came with salsa verde as well. The chips are very filling so be sure to save room for whatever you plan on ordering. The guac portions were also pretty large, so in the future I do think one order would be fine for four people.

I then ordered the seitan tacos, which were excellent. For 7.50, I got three large tacos. They offer both flour and corn tortillas so be sure to specify which you prefer. Their seitan was delicious...tender and with lots of cilantro! I had had seitan once before and did not like it much, but Las Cazuelas changed my mind! Although this restaurant is a little out of the way for me, it is worth it for the inexpensive prices and delicious food!
The food is amazing!! They catered a weekend celebration for 30+ people.  There was plenty to eat and it was absolutely delicious! Thank you!! I will certainly be back.
Best Mole sauce ever. The waitstaff is so friendly and attentive, and very knowledgable about all of the food. Blue corn tortillas are not to be missed! Great find!

Mexican food makes me crazy forgetful. One mention of Jarritos obliterates any prior ban I may have had on artificial colors and flavors and I find myself saying piña without hesitation. Tres leches cake makes me forget I'm lactose intolerant. Bring on three milks! I can take 'em. A good mole makes me forget my own name. Las Cazuelas delivers on all counts. Also, server is adorable. What makes girls with beauty marks so foxy?

So we've been here many times and have loved the waitstaff. The food was amazing but not this visit. The menu changed, new waitstaff, and a horrible experience. $17 for chicken fajitas (3 tiny tortillas, half breast of chicken at most, and lukewarm peppers and onions with a side of cold rice and.black beans -- definitely no sizzle). No sour cream, no salsa, no offer until I asked. We complained twice and our waitress just shrugged her shoulders. When we paid cash, she sheepishly apologized for being short .26 in change which was actually about a dollar when we counted out change for $100. Seriously? You're a business without change? How far you've fallen in service and quality!

I was looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant around Temple, and my oh my did Las Cazuelas deliver with fantastic food, awesome service, AND BYOB. Bring along a bottle of tequila (there's a wine & spirits 2-3 blocks east on Girard), and let them concoct $7 pitchers of margarita magic. Definitely coming back when I'm around!

Oh, and shout out to the cute waitresses too!

Ok so i waited almost til my living social expired, boy am I glad I went.  I had the Camaron Taco YUMMY! Taquitos Poblanoes was amazing, they were tender and the toppings made it delicious. Last was the Los Dos Ceviches which was one each shrimp and talapia ceviche. This was just ok as ceviches go but it's hard to upstage the blue crab ceviche at El Ray.  Overall I was very happy and I will return with my family.

I got the 
Corn on the cob-  A+mazing
The house salad- the dress and mix of veggies was delicious and fresh
And the pork and pineapple tacos which were fantastic... Overall a great experience I will be back.

We hosted our small business's holiday party here for 30 ppl.  It was such a wonderful event, thanks to the owner and rest of Las Cazuelas staff.  The food was truly delicious.  There was something for every palate in our 3 course family style meal.  The servers were attentive without being smothering.  The pricing was very fair.  And definitely order the tres leches cake.  It was so good, I practically licked my plate.
I have been here twice and ordered the same thing.  The pullled pork is just incredible.  Reasonably priced and just a few doors away from The Fire.  Good music and good food!

Excellent food and amazing service. The staff was friendly and the waitress was very attentive. I had the mole poblano and it was just fantastic. The rice was tasty and moist. 
There was a nice ambiance and the seating was comfortable. There aren't enough nice things I can say about Las Cazuelas. A true gem in Philly.

So disappointing!  Service was good but the food is very far from authentic. It doesn't matter what meals cost but they should be good.  The Horchata was the canned kind and not at all what real Mexican Horchata is.  Where was the cinnamon??  The cochinita pibil had way too much seasoning to truly appreciate the achiote.  The sopa azteca had so much heat, maybe to detract from the fact that it is Campbell's condensed tomato soup with strips of tortilla and a couple pieces of cheese.  It's embarrassing to sell something off as real Mexican when it's really not.  More over its sad that the staff in the kitchen looked like they should know what they are doing.
just OK, nothing too memorable, may have been a bit too authentic for my palette. The salsa was tasty, though.

Excellent, plentiful food and bring your own tequila make this spot a must.  Staff is wonderful and the decor is a nice touch.  The sampler appetizer is tasty and authentic and made remember my visits to Mexico!
My favorite taco spot closed on rigid ave but this place was jus as good i jus had to add and additional meat to my dish that i would normally get at my old mexican place!! But it was soooooooo good
Everything was delicious starting from appetizers all the way to dessert! Super authentic, friendly staff, and a cozy quaint atmosphere. Highly recommend!

Lonely hungry traveler looking for a decent meal. Turned out to be more than decent. Chips are not spectacular but the green salsa is yummy. 'pack and take home' good. Adobo sauce pork and tacos were different in a nice way. Not your 'enjoy my evening' dinner place cause the ambience does not support that, but pretty steady food. Would highly recommend for lunch and casual get togethers.

Enchiladas and empanadas to die for!
Good chips/dip!
'nuff said.

The sauces here are very strong so if you good at shoveling carbs and meat down your throat but wary of foreign flavors overwhelming the flavors you are more used to, I'd ask for sauce on the side so you can elect for the portion you desire. 

The price/portion ratio was fairly decent.
The waitress was adorably foreign and friendly.
The parking situation was quite easy.

Do it!

Really tasty and authentic Mexican food for the area. Being from California, I am used to plenty of flavor which I feel is a challenge to find in certain ethnicities of food out east. 

Although the food is tasty, the employees are really helpful, knowledgable and friendly; the food is a little pricey for being Mexican food. Given that I have made plenty of it in my lifetime, I could vouch to say that the ingredients for Mexican food are low cost (and I buy organic). 

But none the less, it is a nice place and would definitely recommend a visit to Las Cazuelas and will most likely be back a few times myself.

Take out was a great experience. I didn't realize how much food we were getting until I had to lug two giant bags back to the car. The food was very good, but I can only imagine it being better in store. And it's byot - so you kinda have to go. 

I will go for the sit down version and update this post free margarita pitcher (check in and get a pitcher free).

Terrible service!  We had a reservation at 8:45 and couldn't get seated until around 9:10.  Once there, we waited 45 minutes for chips and guacamole to come - it never did.  We ended just getting up and leaving.  Avoid this place!

Had a delightful meal here last week! This cute spot was not at all on my radar, but we had a very tasty dinner and enjoyed our meal.

We shared the Flautas to start, which was a nice way to start the meal, and to accompany our chips & salsa. The chips could have been saltier (but then again, I enjoy salt) -  but the homemade salsas were terrific - bright and spicy mmmhmmm.

I ordered the Cancun tacos (tilapia) - which were exactly what I was craving. The grilled fish was tender and the accompanying chipotle mayo made for perfect bites. It is 3 tacos per order, which was the perfect amount.

My boyfriend went for the Cochinita Pibil - which was a generous platter filled with rice, beans, braised pork shoulder, plantains, etc. I snuck a few bites and wow - a ton of flavor. The meat was incredibly tender.

Service was attentive and all-around friendly. 

I need to come back, for sure!
It seems that this place runs a ton of groupon deals. The pricing without a coupon is pretty ridiculous. The food was good and the service was friendly. I wouldn't go here again without a groupon.

I'd like to start by saying it wasn't bad, it just wasn't good.  Certainly not good enough to make it worth my while to go there instead of Cantina a few blocks away.  And most definitely not worth the price, even with a half off deal.  The positives were really difficult to focus on because there was no AC or fans or anything.  Just stagnant, hot air.  Its a shame because it was a lovely, breezy summer night outside.  I guess they're trying to cut costs?  We thought about dessert but I couldn't take the heat anymore.

The server was great, but we were his only table so that's to be expected.  The overall vibe wasn't that of a fun mexican restaurant.  It was eerily quiet and empty and sad.  It didn't feel like a fun dining experience.  It felt like I spent way too much money to eat as quickly as possible and leave.

The nachos were very good.  Nice balance in flavors, but too much topping for too little chips.  Still I'd give the nachos alone 4 stars.  The mole enchiladas were a 2 star dish.  Bland and heavy.  When I spend $20 on 3 enchiladas I expect a certain level of culinary skill, not heavy, dense home cooking.

Overall I went back and forth between 2 and 3 stars.  I settled on 3 stars because the service was good, the food wasn't terrible and I really, really want to like new places in the neighborhood.

The food here is super tasty and they're vegetarian friendly.  Prices were reasonable and it's BYOT or B if you don't drink tequila drinks, which is not an issue for me because man oh man do I!  Beware-- the traditional margarita mix is pretty sweet and made with orange juice since it doesn't have triple sec in it.  

We ate here on a Friday night, sans reservations and were seated pretty much immediately.  The ambience was lovely and the bathrooms clean.  I'll definitely eat here again and try the non-traditional margarita mix next time.

This was my first time using Yelp Deals, and what a treat! My partner and I happened to be in the area and Las Cazuelas popped up as a pretty safe bet, along with a $10 for $20 offer, and even a free pitcher of Margarita mix with check-in. Unfortunately since this was on a whim we didn't have anything to go in it, and we were getting such a good deal already that we didn't even try to ask for a substitute.

We each ended up ordering a torta and swapping halves, so I got to try the wonderful Milanesa (breaded steak) as well as the Yuccateca (pulled pork). For dessert, we shared a very generous portion of Vanilla Tres Leches that was just perfect, and I would probably come back just for that.

All up, we ended up paying an additional $10 to cover the little bit we went over plus tax and tip, so really $20 for a delicious, filling meal for two in a cute little spot with excellent service.

At the tip top of NoLibs, this Mexican joint has some solid fair for veg/vegan types. I got the enchiladas with seitan and enjoyed the hell out of them!

Also the chips and guac were quite tasty and artfully presented.

They don't serve booze but you can bring your own. Fun fact, if you check in here you will get their margarita mix for free. So check in and bring some tequila. Drink for (mostly) free!

I fein for this place. I used to live in the area and as someone who travels and takes her Mexican food very seriously, this place is hands down must try if you're in the area. I have nothing but good experiences here. Try the seafood enchilada for dinner followed by fried icecream. It will change your life!!

love the mexican food - especially the antojitos rancheros.  the ceviche is always super fresh and the other mains - particularly cochinita pibil has great flavor.  i highly recommend the daily specials - especially if you like fish.

only problem is that since it is a byo - well it can get SUPER loud and the restaurant staff will do absolutely nothing to keep people down.  however, if you go on an off night or are part of the party - its a great time.

If you like authentic Mexican food and cozy places rather than big chain types then you can't go wrong with this place. It's BYOB but they will mix up your margarita for you. The service is great and there are a few tables for outdoor seating on nice days.

This was a great find. My friends and I are on endless hunt for mexican and have found the seemingly hole in a wall places to have the most high quality food for this genre (Im serious about the endless hunt, we're guilty of burritos for breakfast). 

This place had some pretty creative dishes and had such authentic fresh ingredients. We had a pistachio mole sauce on some fish enchiladas, which was our selling factor for going in the first place. Who else has pistachio mole sauce?! The chips were made there and had the perfect texture. Both dishes we got had their wow factors and extras we weren't expecting. The enchiladas came with rice and some tasty veggies and the nachos came with meat and guac on it that we didn't expect. 

Rule of thumb: If your mexican places includes oaxaca and chihuahua cheese, they're awesome and probably know what they're doing.

Horrible service. Called to make a reservation and was told they don't take reservations and that it was just walk ins. Arrived and was TURNED AWAY because we didn't have a reservation?? I have never had someone be more rude as a hostess. So unprofessional and will not return.

My girlfriends and I came here for our Girls' Night Out and I love how accommodating they were. They didn't mind waiting for all of us to get there. We told them straight up that we had a Groupon and they did not treat us any worse for it. We even lingered a bit after the meal and they just refilled our water and let us carried on with our conversation. 

There was free chips and salsa, which I really like. What is up with people charging for chips at a Mexican restaurant? That's like charging for bread at an Italian restaurant! My arroz con pollo ($16) was exactly what I wanted. Stuffed with olives, chicken, and avocado with a side of black beans, it was more than enough for my dinner and my lunch the next day. One of my friend ordered the Chicken Mole Enchilada and wasn't too pleased with it, however I think it 's more of a personal preference since the bite I had was really good. Another one didn't care for the cheese on her Crabmeat and Shrimp Enchilada- again, I think that's a personal preference. My other friends were quite pleased with their choices.

My banana crepes ($6) were pretty good, though I didn't see any walnuts like the menu suggested and I think they used plantains instead of bananas. However, the ultimate dessert has to be the Abuleita Hot Chocolate ($3). Since we sat right in front of the kitchen, we were able to see the chef whisked everything together and it was just the perfect thing to end the meal. The waitress even stopped by to apologized for the delay in our hot chocolate since it had to be freshly mixed.

After our coupon, I think we each paid $17, not including tips. Not too bad.

I've been to this restaurant several times and have never been disappointed.  I'm particularly fond of the cactus salad and LOVE their black beans.

Service has always been top-notch and, though, the location is not on the most attractive block, the interior is very, very charming.  We were always offered chips (not greasy) and dip and the servers are extremely accomodating with BYOB.

Though I rarely eat desert, the banana crepe is to kill for.

Ate there about 2 weeks ago. Very good food and excellent presentation. Wait staff is very knowledgeable so ask questions and also try sampling the sauces they serve as well. The place is BYOB but if you bring tequila the restaurant will make margaritas for you at no charge. Overall good time and very much recommended. Try Groupon for coupons as the restaurant has been providing them lately that if you spend $15 you get $30 dollars worth of food. Not a bad deal.

I've been here literally dozens of times. It's always fabulous. As a vegetarian, I really appreciate that I can actually eat their tortilla soup- it's amazing. I have never not gotten it. Everything I have tried, I've loved. Also the staff is phenomenal. I often come with my persnickety grandparents who are the single most difficult patrons I've ever seen. The staff is always super nice and patient, and willing to make something off the menu for them. I can't say enough nice things about this place. Also, it's perfect for a larger since it's BYO. Love this place.

I went back and forth trying to decide whether my experience at Las Cazuelas warranted 2 or 3 stars.  On one hand their food was delicious - seriously amazing guacamole, insane appetizer platter, on point chimichurri asada.  But their service (and this is coming from somebody who NEVER complains about service and always tips more than she should) was TERRIBLE.

You know something is wrong if you've finished the first round of appetizers and you still have yet to get either silverware or sharing plates.  Also those margaritas you asked for never came, until you finally managed to flag down your waitress (after multiple attempts) and practically begged her.  Trying to figure out how the heck you were going to eat the next plate of food without a fork or knife or ANYTHING, you asked the guy who came to clear your plates if you could please get some sort of utensils and maybe plates if that wasn't too much to ask, napkins would be marvelous.  Miraculously after 10-15 minutes of staring at the appetizer sampler your prayers were answered!  But still no napkins.  Your water glass was never refilled throughout the duration of the meal, and it took you 10 minutes to find the waitress to ask for the check, a good 15 minutes for her to bring you the check, 15 more minutes until you could wave her down so she could take your credit card, and 10 minutes until she came back with the receipt.

It really wasn't the waitress's fault either - she was really nice, and it was apparently her first week on the job and she was covering the restaurant BY HERSELF on a Sunday night.  She was clearly trying her best to deal with the crappy situation the management had put her in.  Nobody can cover a whole restaurant (even one as small as Las Cazuelas) by themselves when it's a full house!

All in all I'm probably going to give them another try - like I said, their food was great!  They just have some very obvious service issues to work out.  Scheduling multiple servers would probably be a good start.

I just hope next time we at least get some napkins...

Had a lunch date here with my co-worker. Took advantage of the yelp deal $10 for $20 worth of food. The place is a bit small but very clean and I love the decor inside. It definitely give me that mexican feel. We each got 4 tacos and the bill came out to $22. They start us off with chips and salsa it was very flavorful. I got the pulled pork taco, skirt steak taco, shrimp taco and grilled chicken taco. I enjoyed all or them except the shrimp which was lack of flavor. They can definitely use some extra seasoning. I would definitely be back for more tacos when I'm in the mood for some Mexican food.

Las Cazuelas is a great place to go with friends. Their food is delicious and affordable, and their BYOT makes it even better. Four of us split an appetizer, 3 entrees, a dessert, and pitcher of margaritas and each spent only $20 plus tip. Make sure you get the tres leches for dessert!
My friend and I were very satisfied with my birthday dinner. My tilapia was very good, veggies were a little bland but still pretty good.

Very good food - even better service!

This tiny restaurant is serving up some excellent food! We also found them via Groupon and are so glad we did! Loved the nachos, my tacos were awesome, and my husband had the Abuelitas Ninfas Pollo and he says it is THE BEST Mexican dish he's had in years.

Our waitress was so sweet and another waitress checked on us now and then as well. 

We will be back! Soon!

One word: Empanadas!  

Wow, I ordered the chicken empanadas to go, and when I got home and ate these little beautifies, I was amazed at the flavor, and how the sauce was such a perfect compliment to the taste of empanada.  The crust was perfectly cooked, a golden brown crunchy exterior with a delightful mix of meat, 

The service was great, the dish was prepared fast and they gave me all the fixings I needed to take this home and get started eating right away.  
Quality of Food: 5 stars
Service: 5 stars
Facility: 5 stars

I

I have been to Las Cazuelas twice now and with my most recent experience I can say I will not be returning.  The food is only the secondary issue here.  I agree with a few other reviewers here who say the food isn't bad but it certainly isn't good either.  This is the only mexican place I have ever been where they charge $1 per very small cup of hot sauce!  Granted the hot sauce was very good (really the only stand out part of the meal) but $1 for a cup the size of thimble!? Food aside, the real issue I had here is the service and atmosphere.  First we were placed in a secondary room that was completely empty because the first room was ALMOST completely full (there were still some seats left and we were a party of 2).  We said this was fine because they said it would be a nice quiet room.  It is not.  It is basically the hang-out for the wait staff.  Then about 20 minutes in they seat a party in the room that obviously had reserved the room for a private event!  It was incredibly loud and the private party was as annoyed as we were by having the shared space.  Then our waitress spilled my meal on my lap and blamed it on my bag that was under the table (where else am I supposed to put it when the tables are about 7-8 inches from each other?), took our chips without asking but left our guacamole(??) and took our bottle opener because, although this place is BYO we were told they only keep 2 bottle openers in the whole restaurant!  Overall service was just appalling and even if the food had been stellar it would be hard to recommend this place for anything other than the occasional take out.

Nice, relatively light Mexican fare.  easy for vegetarians.  One of our dishes (the excellent eggplant) was innovative, the rest were old stand-bys, well executed. If this were in California I'd give it 3 stars, But here in Philly, with excellent home-made green salsa, etc, I'm giving it 4 ... a bit overpriced, but fun vibe and great service.
Amazing! I had an event here and the guests raved about the food a week later. The owner is attentive and works w/you! I would definitely recommend and come back!!

Perfectly decent Mexican food. I enjoyed my shrimp taquitos but I wouldn't rave about them, and I couldn't believe the teeny portion of guacamole for $9!

Four stars because they have outdoor seating that is dog friendly and were super kind in bringing our pup a bowl of water!

This is *amazing* Mexican food for Philadelphia. Thoughtfully prepared, great flavor - beats Distrito in University City on price, but not ambiance. Distrito is bankrolled like whoa, and this place has more of a traditional American Mexican restaurant look. I've been about 4x, and have yet to be disappointed. Last time I was here, you had to bring your own tequila, which is of Drama in the state of PA, because their LL was still en route.  

Again, let it be said that if you are from a Mexican food locale, you might not be wowed, but if you are just looking for a great meal at a good price or haven't had non-chain Mexican food many times - I think this place can't be beat. 

You can take the trolley down Girard to get there.
This food is the worst I have ever had. Chipotle and 7/11 offer a better bang for your buck.

I don't know if this restaurant changed ownership or what ... but, some things have changed.  The food does not taste as authentic as it once did and seems to be pre-made and rushed to the table.  NOTE:  Do not order your appetizer and meal at the same time.  They will come out back to back.  Finish your appetizer, then order your meal.

The wait staff has changed, as well.  Though, friendly enough, I think the one girl was totally new and had never waited tables before.  The other girl just runs around the restaurant like she's in a race - not a very relaxing setting.

The place is cute and conveniently located.  I hope that they can go back to the way they "used to be" when it was great.  They have definitely down-scaled in food and service.

The food was just OK.

Mediocre food. 
35 minutes for our food to arrive at a semi busy time. 

Merits a 3 or 4, but we were asked to east idly hurry it up while sitting at the bar area upstairs finishing our food and drinks to accommodate a table that had a reservation but not enough chairs. 

Tried chatting with management but they were not around. Kinda a shitty experience to an otherwise enjoyable cinco de mayo. 

Shan't be returning.

This Place Sucked! Old chips that had dried up salsa on them to start. They said I would get well done steak....it was burnt to a crisp. The red salsa was literally tomato sauce with garlic sprinkled on. Lastly, very very very slow service. If I wasn't an upstanding citizen I wouldn't have even paid. Don't come unless you don't love yourself.

Love this place!  Had a few really nice meals there, and decided to check it out for my sister's bridal shower.  They put together an awesome buffet for a good price.  We used the upstairs room, which was very comfortable and fun.  I hesitate to add this, but we did see a bug - just one - and I doubt any city restaurant is exempt from critters, but seeing it was not fun.  That is the only reason I take it down from five stars to four.  Others may choose not to go because of this, but in defense of the place, it was nowhere near the food, and the owner was extremely apologetic.  I can't say it was an appetizing experience, but I have a realistic approach, and expect that even in the cleanest of places, these things happen.  

The chocolate sauce that is on a few of the items is not my thing, but others in my party loved it.  I think it's more a matter of taste, but I wish I knew ahead of time that it would be so, um, chocolatey.  

I really like supporting local businesses, and this is one I will return to.  

Amazing guacamole!

BYO is great, especially since they will make the margaritas for you.  

Great place!

I've been becoming better acquainted with Latin culture and food checking out this spot and that spot. This isn't a bad spot. Not bad at all. It does seem out of place given the area, but I suppose things will get better. I didn't really get anything special, I just really had a taste for some chorizo tacos. I think there was a better way to go about finding some, but I can't really complain about this place.

The tacos were good and I was satisfied with the chips and dip. I also had a Sidral Mundet... apple soda (I'm kicking myself for buying this... and overall for not getting the Yelp special). It tastes good and I like it, but not for $2.50 I should've asked the price. I tried my first tres leches cake and that was good also, but I still felt it was over priced. As far as I know, it is what it was supposed to be (presentation and all), but I was expecting more both in portion and quality. I'll have to see what other places are offering to really understand. Remember, this was my first try.

The service was cool. There weren't many people in there at the time, but there were enough that the 2 servers and manager (I suppose) kept busy. The ambiance is nice with candlelight and wine glasses awaiting (BYOB). Heh. I just wanted some good food, but Las Cazuelas will do for a potential date spot. I will be back... Yelp deal in tow!

My wife & I have very high standards when it comes to Mexican food. I'm from San Diego originally, and she is from Central California, and her dad's family is Mexican. That being said, Las Cazuelas is definitely one of the best Mexican restaurants we have found on the East Coast in terms of authentic flavors. We've been there twice now from brunch, and last night was the first time we went for dinner.

Dinner was amazing - I got the Mole Poblano, which is probably the best Mole that I have ever had. My wife said it tasted exactly like the Mole that she used to have when she was staying with a family in Ensanada, Mexico. She had a chicken in a special Guajillo chile sauce that was incredibly rich but super delicious.

Brunch both times we have gone blew our socks off. Also, don't miss out on the coffee! Their cafe au lait is superb, and the cafe de olla reminds me exactly of the coffee at a little Mexican place in San Diego that I went when I was young. 

So why only 4 stars? The entree prices for dinner are a little steep. If you go, definitely use a Yelp deal, living social, etc. Brunch prices are right on the money (and portions are huge!), lunch prices seem right, it's just dinner that's a little steep. Granted, the portions are extremely generous (my wife had a full dinner and two lunch portions left to take to work this week), but instead of $16-20, I would expect to see more like $10-16 for dinner prices at a location like this. 

We'll definitely be returning for brunch very soon!

Cute little eatery on Girard. It is BYO, so don't forget your wine or tequila! If you bring tequila they will make margaritas for you! Who doesn't want that? The food was great for the price and the staff was nice. I ordered appetizers for dinner and they were a good sized portion.The kitchen is literally a stones throw from the tables, so I was a little baffled when my quesdillas were lukewarm. Still good, but I prefer my food hot.  It is a very small space. I went on a Tuesday and there were not many people there, so we had no problems with seating, but I cannot imagine what they do on busy nights! We came for the Groupon, but we will definitely be back.

I've been on a quest to find awesome and authentic Mexican food since moving from Southern California, you would think it would be easy to find a handful of favorite Mexican restaurants, alas, my search continues.

Located in a not so affluent area of Philadelphia, this BYOB corner restaurant is small in size, with an open kitchen located between the two downstairs dining areas, we happened to be seated near the kitchen and the basement door, which was utilized quite frequently to bring food items up to be prepared.

As we sat and pondered the menu, we were greeted by our sweet server Hannah and presented with in house made tortilla chips and a  tomatillo salsa verde which had a nice kick to it.  Sometimes I wish that hubby would open a Yelp account as he was thrilled with Las Cazuelas. 

Michael had a huge plate of three large enchiladas, substituting ground beef for the chicken and asking for the mole sauce to be on the side. The mole sauce was amazing, I'm not surprised that it has won awards and I dipped my everything in it! His meal came with a nice sized portion of black refried beans and "Mexican rice", nothing like a Spanish rice, very plain, no onions or peppers, yellow rice.

I could not get past the list of appetizers, so I ordered three as my meal, oh shush...  Queso fundido, which means melted cheese, not, it was one big blob of cheese, nothing dippy or stringy about it, hardened within seconds and it would have taken a knife and fork to cut it and it was not blended with the extra additions of chorizo and mushrooms, but was swimming in a spicy and extremely greasy sauce and served with three tortillas, to do what with, ugh, I have no clue. I packed this up to take home and try to melt, which it refused to do and I kept thinking, imagine what that would do to my arteries, so I chucked it. I guess I could have pretended it was string cheese and sliced it and ate it cold in its hardened form.

The guacamole ranchero was good, nothing special, I've had much better guacamole and chips, but it was satisfying, although a very small portion. The shrimp ceviche was very enjoyable, again, a small portion for the price. I also had a side dish of refried beans, that I asked to be topped with lots of raw onion and cheese and I really did like this dish.

I checked out their brunch menu which is very enticing and I would love to return with gung ho hubby to indulge in this.

I was unfortunately disappointed on my last visit to Las Cazuelas.  With all of our friends heading to Mexico this week, I had a craving for some margaritas and spicy food.  I finally decided to order something other than my usual and I am still regretting it 5 days later  Unlike previous visits when I had always had the vegetarian enchiladas, I decided to try the Chile Rellano. It was definitely a mistake. The overall flavors in the dish were really lacking, which I am assuming was the sauce. Unlike the enchiladas green sauce, the rellano come with a tomato based red sauce. I found it to be bland, even after I added salt and pepper to it. The highlight of the dish was the melted, stringy Oaxaca cheese.  The bf also ordered something different than his norm, and while he enjoyed his arroz con pollo more than I enjoyed my meal he will not be ordering it again either. 

I still really like the vibe and location of this restaurant so we will give them another shot.  I will probably revert to ordering the enchiladas again for fear of disappointment.
Las Cazuelas is such a great place to have authentic Mexican food! Everything is fresh and delicious, and the staff is very friendly.

I bought a Groupon a few months ago.  It was only $10 for $30 (I had a coupon for Groupon).  I figured what the hell.  If it is not good, I will not be too upset.  Boy was I pleasnly surprised!

A co-worker and I went there for lunch one day, my treat because I was filthy rich with a $30 Groupon that day.  We found a parking spot right away and were also seated right away.  So far, so good!

Once we saw that we could mix and match tacos, we went bananas or should I say plantains?  I had one of this, and one of that.  It was like going to a taco-buffet, but with quality food.

We also got the guac appetizer, which was creamier than other guacs I had ever had, but very delicious.  

Their prices and quality are unbelivable and I have been back a few times since.  Actually, I think I may be going back one day this week and so should you!

What can I say about Las Caz? The food, employees, and clientele all combine to make the ideal environment for an excellent time!

Went with a group of 6 last night and were seated almost immediately upon arrival.  Mike (our waiter) and Michelle (also waiting that night) were absolutely great! The recommendation for enchiladas con cangrejo y camarones (crab and shrimp enchiladas) ended up being a big crowd pleaser. The only hesitation I had was that it was lacking some heat and the chip salsa didn't have quite enough in it to compensate when added to the enchiladas. I do, however, have a high tolerance for spicy foods.

Onto the service-Mike, Michelle, Jorge, and the whole crew made us feel incredibly welcome and were happy to have a good time with everyone while still providing excellent service. 

We will absolutely be returning to Las Caz-next Thursday in fact!

I've come here multiple times on their awesome groupon deal. Space is small but welcoming, nice ambiance. Casual but still classy. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Food is great and filling for the price, plus the premixes plus byob tequila/rum is a gamechanger. Can't say enough good things.

I've been a couple of times and enjoyed each meal. Simple, authentic Mexican food. I do think the prices are a tad high, but I'm used to eating Mexican food over by the Italian Market. Perhaps competition keeps them cheaper, but I can eat over that way for half the price sometimes. It is nice that its BYOB and they do have items on their menu that are a bit more "upscale" than you will find at other similar restaurants. I will say the tres leches cake is to die for and the best Ive ever had.
This place is fantastic AND a BYO.  It has great ambiance and the food is wonderful.  They have great vegetarian options as well.

Good food, great chips. Needs better salsa, no flavor. Had the carnitas and it was amazing! It's BYO tequila, get the regular margarita mix. AVOID THE pomegranate it was sooo sweet and taste like cough syrup.

I've been here before and the food was good but hostess was extremely rude. her actions were deplorable basically kicked us out for asking to sit us. we called before and she said she could sit us. extremely annoying and waste of money to get there

The best Mexican BYO in the city, home to my favorite salad: House salad with seitan. I live close by and usually have a fantastic experience dining here. The food is reasonably priced. The staff is excellent (although sometimes, albeit rarely, our wait staff will less than an ideal grasp on the English language). And there are plenty of vegan options, including salad, several tacos, a main entree, and a burrito sans cheese and sour cream, although in the future I hope they'll add some more dedicated vegan items to the menu. For reference, I've been coming here for 4+ years.

This place was great. I got the Conchinita Pibil, and my girlfriend got the vegetarian Rajas de Puebla, and they were both delicious. The tres leches and the cheesecake buñuelo were also delicious -- especially the cheesecake.

This place is the real deal..... I grew up in southern CA. in the Imperial Valley which is right next to the border of Mexico and we went to Mexicali every chance we could go, why?? because of the food, and the fireworks of course.  I grew up eating the most authentic mexican/spanish food available in this country and I'm blown away by how this place brings me back home.  The tacos are the best I've had since I've been on the east coast.  I just moved to Philly about a year ago, however I spent the last 7 years all over nyc and this place is the shit!!! They only serve thier tacos at lunch for some reason, however, I went in one time for dinner and they were nice enough to hook me up.  5 stars baby.

Tonight I was hungry and was craving Arroz con pollo. I checked for it on Yelp and came across this place. I can say what I had was very good. It had a nice lil kick to it too!

For dessert I ordered the Tres Leches cake, can I tell you that sh!t was the bomb! I'll come back again and again for the cake! 

Good dinner and will be back!

I am a vegetarian and was thrilled to see they had seitan on the menu as a protein option.  I began eating my leftovers today and there was pork or chicken hidden in the middle.  Whether this was intentional or not, it is EXTREMELY disappointing.  You should be able to trust a restaurant.  If this was intentional, not only was it not funny but my belly hurt all day.  If this was unintentional, than I would have to comment on the lack of organization and cleanliness of the restaurant because we were one of three tables there all night, there was no reason to get pork mixed in a vegetarian dish.  Completely disappointing.  I understand that a meat eater may not understand why this is such a big deal, but it is IMPORTANT to me.  They are lazy and cannot be trusted.  Even if you eat meat, if this is how they run their restaurant, what are they half-assing for you? Do not eat here.   Terrible, terrible disgrace for a restaurant.

Went for lunch, and for lunch it was very good. Sat outside on a sunny day and right away got homemade chips and really good salsa. 
I'm not an expert of Mexican food, but everything we got seemed fresh and had great flavors to it. The empanadas had very good fillings and were light and not greasy.
Probably some of the best empanada's I've had in downtown Philly.
Next time will have to try some of the other dishes and do an update.
I understand it's BYO, which is great, and nice seating outside.

Food was great and more authentic than a lot of mexican places around. Pretty reasonably priced.  It's BYOT.  Margarita mix was decent - a little on the sweet side for my taste, but got the job done.  Definitely looking forward to going back.  Used a $20 for $10 Yelp deal.  Worked great.
Amazing service and BYOB!! Great place to have a candlelight dinner. The food was great. The guacamole was also amazing with a great presentation.

Great Mexican! The guacamole is very fresh tasting and delicious. I would recommend the quesadillas with chorizo! It's priced as an appetizer but enough for a meal. The chorizo is spiced perfectly. One of our favorite restaurants in the area.

This place was great. I went there on a Friday night and had not problem. The wait was nice and very helpful. I suggested BYOT.....bring your own tequila. Their margarita mix was cheap and tasted great (if you don't like too sweet go with the original).

Otherwise the food was reasonably priced and delicious. I went with a friend and we share an app and each ordered an entree and we left spending about 20 if that.

My boyfriend and I hit up Las Cazuelas for a casual date night and were really pleased with our experience. We got the Yelp check in for a free pitcher of mags, of which we added our own tequila to! The margaritas were good, except we wanted salt around our glasses and no one offered. We started with guac and the complimentary chips and salsa. The guac and salsa were excellent ---very fresh, vibrant, flavorful. We did not enjoy the thick-cut chips so much. I absolutely LOVED the pork tacos with grilled pineapple. They actually bumped my review up from a 3 to 4 star. My boyfriend did not enjoy his chicken enchiladas as much, but I think it was a more acquired taste. Our server was a little odd...he randomly interrupted our order to go seat a patron who walked in which we thought was rude. He seemed a little unexperienced but was friendly none the less. We left full and buzzed off the margs so of course we had a great time!

Very reasonably priced and authentic Mexican - they had two cheeses that my husband (who lived in Mexico for two months) rarely gets to enjoy stateside. The atmosphere was cute but not crowded or too loud, great for a date night or out with a small group of friends. Our server was awesome, steering us away from "interesting" dishes towards ones he knew we would love. The chef even accommodated my husband's preferences for fajitas (not officially on the menu) and flour instead of corn tortillas. Will definitely be back!

I love mexican food, especially authentic places. This is def one of the more authentic places around nolibs area. They are Byob, so you can bring a bottle of tequila and they have margarita mixers to mix it for you. I had the classic and it was good, but they made the a little weak. I would have preferred them to put a little more tequila in them. The chips and both salsas were really good and im sure the chips are homemade in house. I ordered the arroz con pollo and it was amazing! Very flavorful and moist and large portions as well. My bf got the cochinita pibil, which was good, but didn't compare to the arroz! I heard they have the best mole sauce so I can't wait to come back and try the mole enchiladas!

One bad thing about this place, however, is the service. I went on a slow tues night and the service was extremely slow and kind of incompetent! But I am always willing to overlook that for good food, so it was worth it!

Went there for a group birthday party. Very tastefully decorated, quaint and clean neighborhood place. I think it has been redone since the picture was taken. Open air balcony upstairs overlooks the street, perfect for summer. Friendly staff and delicious, authentic Mexican food. A really good experience.

This was such a great find for excellent, traditional tacos and a huge variety of things to choose from. The BYO margaritas were also great - $7 with a bottle of tequila. Service was very friendly, it felt like I was being welcomed into the family. Highly recommend!
ordered takeout... tacos.. delicious.. nachitos.... delicious... empenadas... amazing! next time we might eat in and check in for that free margarita pitcher!

I went to this charming little place tonight because I had a groupon voucher that was going to expire tomorrow. Not only was the food delicious, but the waitresses were so pleasant! It made for a great atmosphere, along with the adorable décor.

The food was so fresh and authentic.  The entrées would have been a little expensive without the voucher but you get a good amount of food. Definitely worth at least trying once. 

I will definitely be returning!
I've only been here once, and I would definitely make the trip again. Uh food was pretty great.. I love their mole sauce. Service was good too.

Came here on a week night with a Groupon deal and got bonus dining points on OpenTable! Note that the door on Girard isn't the actual door so you gotta go around to the 4th Street side to enter. It looks like a hole in the wall but apparently it received a Best of Philly award from Philly Magazine around 2001?  

Here's what we got:
- Plantano Yuccateco ($7) - Never had stuffed plantains before! I liked the ground beef on top, kind of a nice surprise!
- Pastor Tacos (3 for $8.50) - I'm a fan of pork tacos with pineapple and enjoyed this.
- Fajita El Vaquero ($14.50 + $1.50 for steak) - It was good at the time, but was too oily and felt heavy. At this point in the meal, the oilines from the plantains earlier and this felt too heavy for one meal. I liked the side of guac, but I didn't care much for the beans and rice.

Overall, not bad for the Groupon deal but not sure if I liked it that much that I would come back versus trying out another Mexican place. Had a wonderful server though and service was professional, so still a good experience.

My mom had Flautas and I had steak, peppers/onions, beans and Mexican rice - all amazing! We also got a free pitcher of virgin pina colada which was sweet to perfection. Definitely worth another visit!

Went here last Saturday after buying the Eversave coupon about a month ago. Great timing as we stopped by the liquor store and all the tequila was on sale. 

As a vegetarian I was very pleased with the varitety of choices, I ended up ordering the cheese enchiladas which were excellent and seemed much more authentic then what I have had other places.

I also had the flan for dessert which was lovely. 

The service and atomsphere were excellent and we will definitely be returning, hopefully soon when it warms up for the outdoor tables.

Las Cazuelas has been around for a while now and I can definitely say that the food continues to impress. Las Cazuelas does not cater to the tex-mex crowd, instead the restaurant focuses on the traditional Mexican stylings. I especially like the the plantain chip appetizer special and the Conchita Pibil (although it definitely tastes different in Mexico). I have tried other items on the menu and have never been disappointed. The dessert menu is pretty decent and the tres leche is always ordered by a few people at our table. Although the tres leche is tres bien, I tried the banana crepe dessert once and have not gone back to tres leche. I love that the chips and salsa are served right after you sit down. For all the awesomeness that the food brings to the table, the wait staff always leaves me feeling under appreciated. For the most part, the staff is not very attentive. I'm sorry, but yes I do want a refill of my water and chips/salsa without having to ask. I also want the waiters to notice when we need another bottle of wine opened. 
On the subject of wine...Las Cazuelas is byob. Unlike Lolita, Las Cazuelas provides the margarita mix free of charge (I have not picked up the bill in a while, so I am assuming this is still the case). Overall, this is a great byob for consistently good food.

Fantastic restaurant in Fishtown. Came here for lunch with my significant other. Service was nearly instantaneous and very friendly. The guacamole for an appetizer was chunky with a good blend of lime and cilantro but not overpowering. Gave a sweet and tangy taste. Both of us got the carne Asada tacos. Steak had great texture and was cooked perfectly. Soft taco with nice blend of spices lime and cilantro again. Clean atmosphere and environment with amazingly fast service. Will definitely be coming balc

Attention vegan and vegetarian people!   If you have not been here in a while (for me it was 2 years) you should give it another try.  They have responded to customer demand (and the fact that there are 3 other hipster-mex places within 4 blocks).  Now you can substitute seitan in almost any of the dishes and they are very accomodating.  I originally hated to go here because my friends would say how delicious their meals were while i was stuck eating a cactus salad.  Not that the salad was bad, but I like to have options, you know?  We recently went for lunch and the two of us ate for less than $15, and it was really good!  The complimentary tortilla chips are the best amongst the local competition.  Owner is a long-time NL resident and neighborhood supporter.  Give it another shot.  I was so glad that I did.

The food is authentic and decent, nothing special really. However, the service is very bad. If you ask for anything to be customized, they punish you the whole while by bringing your food out late and they are rude. There's plenty of other places to get good Mexican food, there should be no need to come here.

The most mediocre Mexican restaurant in the area. 
I ordered through Grub Hub, after reading the reviews assuming it would be flavorful and filling. I was wrong. The steak taquitos were bland and the steak was over cooked. The shrimp taquitos had no flavor. The chips that came with the guac were sooooooo hard - thought I was going to chip a tooth. 

My mother had been there in person two summers ago and said it was good but her meal wasn't tasteful either. 

I was very unsatisfied with my meal. Im giving them 2 stars because I ordered through grub hub and they were quick and nothing was missing from my order.

Food: 3.5
Decor: 3.5
Ambiance: 4
Service: 3.5
Value: 4.5

Love the BYOT aspect of this place! Nice outdoor seating, and decent food as well. The cheap and delicious margaritas are the star here.

My fiance and I came here on a whim for a date night. We love authentic Mexican food that isn't overly pricey (some places charge $20 for some beans and rice... really people?!) and where the setting makes us feel like we've traveled outside our local area. This place exceeded our expectations, AND our server was awesome to top it all off. I got the crab enchiladas and I shared some of the sampler appetizer platter. Oh my goodness was I in love. 

I didn't realize it was BYOB (my fault) but there's a liquor store within walking distance. 

Highly highly recommend.

The first time I visited it was phenomenal, the second time it was significantly less than stellar. The first time I visited was with a group of of 7 for my birthday and it was great! The service was wonderful, they were prompt, accommodating and did not rush us at all. The only thing I wasn't crazy about the first time was the mole chicken enchiladas I got...I think I just didn't like the sauce but everyone else was happy with their meals. The last time we went which was last weekend was a bit different. Again it was 7 people and again for my birthday...the restaurant I had initially planned on was overbooked (not that I didn't wanna go here I was just trying to change it up) so Las Cazuelas was the only place that was able to make last minute accommodations for a party of 7 on a Saturday night (AND we were running late and they were super nice about it so props on both counts). However, I think they just got slammed because the waitress we had was sweet but all over the place. She checked in with us twice to get our order then disappeared for a while to the point where we had to flag someone down to get her to come back. It took about an hour for our food to come out and at the last minute before our food came out we were told they were out of crab so someone had to re-order (it ended up being a mix-up but still it was at least 45 minutes after we placed our order that they came out to tell us this). When they brought out the dishes they brought them out at all different times instead of together (like it was 10 minutes from when the first person received their food to the last person to get their's, and the last person had to inquire about it before someone brought it out) I really enjoyed my dish (I got the crab enchiladas) but a few people at my table weren't satisfied with theirs (meat was overcooked and someone else got the mole enchiladas which they didn't like either). 

Overall I like this place and may return again, the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating and for the most part the food is really good. It was just that of the two experiences we had here the second one paled in comparison to the first.

I really enjoyed from beginning to end, the food was great and authentic.I recommend u bring your own tequila for the margarita mix they offer, and the fried ice cream was awesome, By the way we went here on Father's Day and my boyfriend was very much pleased!
I did not know what to expect, but this place is great, from the food to the service. I am not a real Mexican food fan but this was really good.

5 stars for the food!  What a fabulous find in a Girard Ave. location.
We enjoyed our dinner here very much!

I had a Pineapple Strawberry Daiquiri (BYO Booze) and some amazingly good ceviche - shrimp and tillapia.

My husband's chicken enpanadas were so good, too (I got a bite!).

For entrees he had a tender and flavorful shredded pork with super-fresh corn tortilla black refried beans and rice. He liked it alot.  I really loved the Eggplant Tower - a great vegetarian (NOT VEGAN - it's overloaded with 2 kinds of cheese) choice served over white rice and a home-made tomato & onion sauce.

Desserts are very well done here, too at $6-$6.50 each we tried the banana crepes and cheesecake bunuelos.

Delicioso! We can't wait to come back (The crab & shrimp enchiladas and Carne Azada are calling to me.)! They also do weekend brunch - which sounds marvelous.

Service by our sweet cambodian server (He's a doll!) was attentive and great.

And a big thanks to Eversave (the groupon knock-off) without whom I never would have tried this place.

A super-great find!

Went here for Cinco de Mayo and thoroughly enjoyed our meals.

I highly suggest using the Yelp $10 for $20 deal towards your bill. As college students, this rendered quite well for our pockets because their dinner entrees are $15-$20 each.

*It is also BYOB, so bring your own bottle of tequila and they will supply you with your choice of a complimentary margarita mix with a Yelp check-in*

Food:

As our app, the three of us split the Queso Fundido. This is more of a two person app, but after snacking on the complimentary chips and salsa, it sufficed.

The entrees are very large and if you snack on chips/salsa and an app before, I promise you will be rather full. Which, was terribly unfortunate because we did not have enough room to explore their dessert menu.

Overall, the staff is very nice and helpful. Seating is offered outfront, first floor, second floor and outside on the deck. (A perfect spot to catch the sun setting on the west side of Girard around 8pm in the summer.)

Enjoy!

This place was amazing-- I highly recommend the passionfruit margarita (it's BYO tequila and they mix it themselves). Yermin was our server and she was very attentive and gave great recommendations. The churros, tacos and empanadas were all amazing! I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a good vibe, great food and yummy drinks!

The service was great. We really wanted to be happy. The guacamole was tasty. The beans and rice were a nice departure from typical refried with greasy rice. However, neither of us would give it another shot. The pork was so dry and hard it was difficult to cut, and impossible to eat without lots of something saucy. The flavor wasn't worth the effort (rather "lack of") so I sent it back asking for a "chef's choice" on the replacement, thinking that was my best shot. It's sitting in the frig. We have eaten Mexican and fusion versions of these foods across the South and up the West Coast. So sad that this was such a disappointment and such a pricey one at that. I'm seriously glad they have their fans, but we are not among them!

Now officially my favorite Mexican restaurant in Philadelphia. Where do I begin?

I went in on a sunny Sunday afternoon while on the way to meet some friends at the 941 Theater. The place was empty and there was only one waiter working.

I ordered the camarones tropical at the behest of the waiter. While waiting for my meal, I was pleasantly surprised to be given free chips and salss. This is not a taqueria. There's not a burrito on the menu, so they are under no obligation to give you chips and salsa, but they did anyway. While the chips were average, the red sauce was very good.

The entree came out. It was an array of jumbo shrimp with rice, mixed veggies and plantains all bathed in a coconut milk, mango and habanero sauce. It was one of the tastiest meals I've ever had. The shrimp were cooked just right. The vegetables and rice were fresh and hot. The plantains were crunchy, which was a perfect addition since I love some crunch mixed in with my food. And the coconut/mango/habanero sauce was stellar. It made the meal. It was some of the best Mexican I've ever had, and I'll go back in a heartbeat.

The place got a little more crowded and the waiter was alone, so I was aware that some of the customers had to wait a little bit longer than I did, but trust me, the food at Las Cazuelas is worth the wait.

It's really sad because 2 days ago this place would have gotten 4 stars from me. While the service is often disappointing the food is usually delicious and, as a local, I was quickly becoming a regular. I would have come to this restaurant without any deals but they are always on groupon or something similar so, we of course use those when we can. My mom, knowing I was a fan, purchased one for my fiancé and I as well as one for herself.

Last night she decided to come in for dinner and was excited to try it here. As we both had the groupon and it was expiring soon she called ahead, TWICE, to ask if we could both use it. The girl who answered claimed she spoke to the owner and as long as we got separate checks it was fine. She drove in from NJ. Upon arrival our waiter told us he couldn't take the groupons, despite my mom's calls. We were disappointed and after discussing with him, he agreed that as long as we did separate checks it would be fine. We even made an effort to separate our tables to make the waiter more comfortable. We had a good meal, the food took a long time to come out and didn't come out at once but otherwise everything was good. My step dad was ready to tip our waiter very generously for being so accommodating.

The waiter returned to drop our two SEPARATE checks and informed us that he was sorry but could in fact only take one groupon. Really? So we were lied to not once, but twice. For the sake of $13 this restaurant lost 4 patrons, 2 of which were quickly becoming regulars and recommending it to everyone. Now we will tell everyone to avoid it because of this terrible customer service. I hope it was worth it.

Love Las Cazuelas! Everything I have had here is delicious. I love their guacamole, and my favorite entree is the seafood enchiladas ("de cangrejo"). I also love that they are BYOB - their margarita mix is usually pretty good, not too sweet or watery. Great complimentary chips and salsa as well. It's pretty small inside, so probably not the best for children - it's rather quiet and intimate. I am always able to find parking on Girard, or right behind the building. Just received a $25 gift card via Restaurant.com to use there as well, so I can't wait to go back!

Pretty good Food however view of kitchen from patron seating leaves a lot to be desired. If the kitchen will be completely visible to patrons I would suggest it look a little cleaner and neater. In addition, my husband and I were the first patrons with a $30 bill...gave $40 expecting change to tip and the waitress/hostess indicated there was no change and that we would have to walk across the street for change 

Ridiculous!

Great Mexican food in Philly!!  My friend who had been here before took me the other night and WOW!!
The mole and tomatillo sauces are both outstanding.  The guacamole is delicious.  The banana dessert [we had a coupon that included dessert or margarita mix] was also tasty.
Can't wait to return to try something else!

Our meal at Las Cazuelas was decent but not great. I had a shrimp dish that came served in a steaming hot stone dish, and the table shared chips and guac. This restaurant is BYO tequila. They will provide a variety of flavors of margarita mix. We came for a birthday party, so we had a good time enjoying our drinks, but I would not recommend coming here if you are really searching for a good meal.

Every time I order from here I am amazed! I am a toco fiend. The weirdest meat the better. However, nothing is weird about the squash blossom taco or the corn smut fantastic for a vegetation option. The chorizo is killer. All I want is some lengua and I know they would kill it!

After a hustling and bustling morning of running errands, I was hungry! lol

A friend called for a lunch rendezvous, and with a voucher from Eversave for $35 worth of food at Las Cazuelas, that was where we headed.  =)

It was a perfect breezy afternoon for lunch outside.  The restaurant was pretty quiet @ 3pm, so it was nice to have the sidewalk to ourselves.
We ordered:: all appetizers...
Nachos, Beef flank Tacos, Chicken Empanadas, Tortilla Soup, and Rivera Salad, + 2 beverages

Everything was fresh and in good portions.  We sat and sampled the plethora of food, gossiped and caught up on each other's lives......... unfastened our pants button, and attempted to go for seconds.  With eyes bigger than our stomachs, we had to give up even though we hate wasting good food.... too little to take home, but too much to finish. LOL

Check total: $45.37
 Eversave : -$35.00
                   -------------
                      $10.37 

Now, thats what I call an awesome lunch!  Good service, good food = 5stars

Such great authentic Mexican - and such great prices! They almost always have a Groupon, and we frequent this place almost every week. Their queso fundito is to die for - and their version of tortilla soup is amazing. Absolutely a diamond in the rough!

I loved this place.  We ended up choosing this place for the bf's big 30 and annual christmas dinner.  They were able to accommodate our group of about 15.  They seated us in a room all to our selves downstairs.  It was a cute space.  It could easily fit about 20 people comfortably.  Jessie took care of us the whole night and she was great.  She was patient, we were a bit rowdy and everywhere.  Everyone enjoyed their meals.  No complaints.  Great price for margarita pitchers.  This is a nice place to go for big group. You can't go wrong with mexican and byob.  I will definitely be back to check out the rest of the menu.

If you, too, are on a quest for the must-eat Mexican restaurants of Philadelphia, this must be on your list. Intimate, ambient, and succulent, this BYO restaurant  churns out great, and surprising, food. Let's just say that it is NOT an upscale taco bell. I had a seasoned steak over Mexican-seasoned potato pancake. Delicious! The tres leches cake was admirable, too!
The food is absolutely delicious and so flavorful & the service is great. The burrito I had was massive and I ended up taking half of it home! Definitely recommend for anyone in the area!

I had been to this restaurant twice, and I was very excited to take my friends there tonight. I called to make a reservation for 7:00pm. I was informed that there were no reservations for earlier than 7:30pm. I said, "No problem, I'll take a reservation for 7:30." The woman asked for my name and informed me that if I wasn't there by 7:30, we would lose our reservation. I replied, "No problem. We will be there by 7:15.!" We got there extra early (about 7:05pm) so that we would not lose our reservation. We gave  the young woman at the host stand our name. She said, "it says you were supposed to be here by 6:30." I explained that that could not be possible, and I went through the whole exchange I had with the woman on the phone. She unapologetically stated, "we have to go by the book," and completely dismissed us. I pleaded with her and reassured her that our reservation was definitely for 7:30 according to my conversation with the woman over the phone. I had friends driving from pretty far to meet us there. She repeated, "we can't seat you," and basically walked away from us. It was freezing cold and sleeting outside. We had taken an Uber there and had no choice but to stand there and call our friends and wait for our uber back home. It was humiliating. As a young professional couple with no children, we go out often, and I have never been treated this way. The woman (and everyone else in the restaurant) was so rude and dismissive, despite the fact that the restaurant made an error. No apology whatsoever was offered. So, I asked to speak to a manager (something I have never done!). She replied that there was no manager (???!!!). I understand that mistakes happen, and that's ok.  However, it was the rude, dismissive behavior that really got to me. Even the slightest attempt at an apology would have ensured that I was not prompted to write a negative review of this restaurant that I really enjoyed eating at before. Sadly, with this terrible service experience, I could NEVER see myself returning there or recommending this place to anyone. To the managers, owners, hostesses at this place, you have my phone number - the reservation was for four people at 7:30pm on Saturday, February 17th, not 6:30!!!! Your apologies are still welcome and would be greatly appreciated. You really put a damper on a night that was meticulously planned to celebrate a dear friend's birthday. I hope you never treat anyone else like this again!

I must say this is my first time writing a review That's how disappointed I am of this place! 
Super Slow wait time 1hr for food! Pupusas were soooo greasy I mean I know Pupusas are greasy but this ones were dripping grease! Definitely would not recommend this place! Definitely not coming back!
