Very very salty. Cute place, nice decor, pretty comprehensive Mexican menu, but if you're prone to dehydration or a distrust for salty food, I'd steer clear.  Staff was very friendly and price is decent if you get the Groupon.
Great meal, not crazy expensive, easy street parking.

I don't know how or why I had this place bookmarked but I decided to make a Saturday night reservation here because of its location in relation to The Met concert venue. Even though we had a reservation, there was a lot of confusion at check in. We were being helped by a young boy (maybe 10-12 yo). After standing around for 10 min or so he sat us at a table in the main dining room with the worst sun glare imaginable. We then waited another 10 minutes or so to get seated in the back room, which was freezing cold. 

Our server was dazed and confused. There was a large party in the back room with us that just seemed to completely overwhelm him. He would deliver something to our table and then just walk away quickly, so we had to call after him to come back because we needed something. 

The guacamole was bland. We had to add salt and pepper to make it edible. The chips provided were bottom of the bag crumbs, so we had to flag the server down for more. The chicken tacos and chicken enchiladas were okay, but nothing special. The enchiladas came with a mole sauce, which for me was an acquired taste. The rice and beans also lacked flavor. 

The restaurant is BYO which I didn't realize ahead of time. 

I would not recommend going out of your way to dine here... there are much better Mexican restaurants in the city!

Hands down the best fish tacos I've had in Phildelphia! I opted to get them on flour tortillas because it's easier to hold and they were delicious!! Every component was flavorful and the fish was cooked perfectly. I loveeeed them!

Latin food is close to my heart as there are tons of Mexican restaurants where I grew up.  I was ecstatic when my friend suggested a group of us BYO here as it is supposedly a Venezuelan restaurant.  

I have always sat in the larger party rooms, but the front room is small and dimly lit.  Romantic for a couple on a less crowded night.  The chips and salsa are a little on the salty side.  You do not need to order extra hot salsa or extra hot anything if it already comes hot at this restaurant.  I love spicy and asking for more here has gotten the best of me.  The chicken and rice is to die for as well as anything with shrimp.  Both come succulent and well-seasoned.  The rice is cooked a little differently than most traditional mexican rice.  It's hard and tastes a little undercooked, similar to a lot of authentic paella dishes from Spain.  That's how it's suppose to be prepared, but if you like it more well-cooked, they're happy to oblige.  My roommate ordered a shrimp salad (again, anything with their shrimp can't go wrong).  Everyone loved what was ordered.  Dessert was also really yummy.  The flan was smooth and creamy and the fried bananas were also a go.  I don't think you can order wrong on the menu.

Since it is byo, they have a special where if you have a certain number of people and order several pitchers of magarita mix, the first one is on the house!  So yes to bringing tequila and making it a fun night to remember.  The waiters are happy to take shots all around.  We even got the cooks to come take one with us since it was close to closing time.  A fun and tasty place to be if you're looking to reconnect with a group of people.

Food is good and reasonably priced, but if I were to compare it to one of the more "higher end" places in Center City, it was alright. The atmosphere is good and the service is wonderful. My recommendation is go with a group of friends, bring a bottle of tequila, and split some margaritas.

My first time here and I liked it. Just liked. Its a really lovely spot a little small but still very nice. The ceviche was awesome! Like OMG awesome. I also had the Enchiladas Mole and I have to say I wasnt a fan. And the serving of rice is so tiny we had to order extra. The menu dosent give you many options, and its a little pricer than I expected. Ooooh and def not a place for kids. I love that its BYOB and even if its just for the ceviche, I think I'll come back and give it another try.

So disappointed in this place. I have ordered before and this time I placed a large order over $100 for my family. However there were 2 items missing. I called both the driver and the restaurant and was stunned with their response. They were so rude and did not take any responsibility saying that everything was sent. I told them I was missing the flan and the guacamole and no resolution at all. Claiming they sent it to me. I paid them full amount and no flan and no guacamole. They did not apologize nor offer to send missing items. They stole from me. A bunch of thieves they are!!  Horrible that in this time a restaurant would take advantage of customers trying to support our community.  I will never order from them again. And I suggest you stay away from these thieves.

This Mexican restaurant is decent at best. It is a tiny spot in the Fishtown area, but was able to accommodate a large group of 15 in a side room area. I do love the fact that the place is byob also, so you can save a little cash from buying drinks. They will also make margaritas for you if you bring your own tequila. Our waiter was patient with our large group and was able to accommodate our large group.

The food wasn't bad I felt. The nachos were stacked with toppings, but the chicken was a bit dry. I ordered Cancun tacos as my entree. They were ok, but needed more of that spicy sauce and more than a tiny piece of tilapia. At least the prices weren't high there. Not bad, I would go again if I wanna save on drinking.

Took out the girls for my sisters bachelorette party kick off dinner ... We arrived on time with 12 girls. When we walked in I told them I wanted to be out in one hour so we could get in the limo and start partying. They completely nailed it. I had ordered the family style food in advance.... Food starting coming out immediately. Margaritas were delicious and made immediately! Service was perfect on a Saturday night! Try the Mole !!!!! The price - unbelievable. It's hard to please everyone and they did it... We all walked out happy. Great vibe upstairs for large party. Very private. Loved it!

The food was okay. They only allow one groupon per table so keep that in mind. If want some better food of similar type go down the street to Sanchos Pistolas.. you can even walk there.. its not that far.

UPDATE: I branched out from my usual order and tried a burrito- unfortunately, I regret my choice. I ordered the "El Tejano Burrito" with carnitas, no mixed vegetables, and also requested the "tomato sauce" on the side. The rice was bone dry, and tasted old and overcooked. There was no sour cream, very little guacamole, and the tortilla was also very dry. The ingredients were not fresh, and it seemed like they put the bare minimum of each ingredient. 

I have loved everything I've ever tried from Las Cazuelas, both delivery and when dining in, but this burrito was totally out of character. I will not be ordering this item again. 

----------------
Ordered delivery via GrubHub- "Nachitos" (no jalapeños) and "Pastor Taquito". I ordered around 6:30pm, and food was at my door by 6:50! Everything was incredible and cannot wait to order again soon!

Okay, I came to eat here with a group of 5, the place is small like 10 tables small keep that in mind. First of all some servers looked lost. The prices on the menu are wrong. On the menu tacos are 9 but on the check they was 10$, like come on. And there are no drinks on the menu. I had to ask the servers about the drinks. Like why couldn't she tell me about the drinks. The server should tell the guest about the drinks. Ok after that we ordered our appetizers and our drinks so we got our appetizers but we had to remind our server 3 times about our drinks. We order nachos and guacamole. The guacamole was so lemony and the salsa verde had no salt what so ever. So we asked for salt and again we had to remind her 3 times for the salt. We order a torta and it was not what I expected. It was so plain and we ordered the soup of the day but it was extremely spicy like there was no warning about it being spicy. Like warn us first. Okay so we get our entrees and we ordered a side of salsa roja and when I say it's expired it's expired. So we told our server and she took it to the chef and the chef said it was just garlic. I don't know if the chef has no taste buds but a salsa roja doesn't taste bad just because of garlic. It was expired. And then the server gave us our check but then took it back because "she forgot to add the service fee" when it was 5 guest but law says it's supposed to be 6+ guest like what. Her service wasn't a 20% tip. Seriously . In conclusion this place is not recommended.

I have eaten here a few times and I always enjoy it.  It is BYO and they have a variety of mixers you can order for $7.  The reg margarita is the best and if you like rum punch, bring a bottle and mix it with the punch. It's great!!!

If the weather is nice we will sit outside and I would make reservations to be safe as you can never really tell when it will or won't be busy. They have 4 separate rooms to eat in. 2 upstairs and 2 downstairs.  I like the downstairs back room best.

Though the entrees are good, I recommend ordering a bunch of appetizers and share if you are with a group of people.  The queso with mushrooms is amazing! I also enjoy the ceviche and guacamole.  The sopa azteca is good but just know that there is a little spice to it.  I have had the Chuleta Tentacion and Arrechara. Both were good but I prefer their appetizers.  The banana crepes and vanilla tres leche are great for dessert, if you have room!

They also often run groupon and living social deals ($25 for $60). You can't beat it.  Can't wait to go back again.

Someone needs to hold me back because I'm about to GO OFF on this so called "establishment"

I stroll in here with a bunch of my gal pals on cinco de mayo looking to get into the holiday spirit by dining on some Spanish cuisine. We were all patiently waiting near the entrance awaiting to be seated, after being told multiple times that we had our own separate dining area, and that they'll take care of us soon, blah blah blah. Look I get it, everyone wants to celebrate the holiday so these type of places can get real crowded and rambunctious. But after waiting for ONE HOUR (yes you read that correctly) we were ultimately told that we couldn't be served and seated. How dare that peasent hostess have the absolute audacity, the unmitigated gaw, to tell us that we couldn't be seated after telling us multiple times that we would be catered to. Now this is when things got fiesty, and confrontational. Understandably, we were all furious. I mean half of my friends faces were turning sickeningly pale because of guacamole defiency. When we confronted them in a civil matter, they had the indecency to call the authorities because we were getting "out of hand" and speaking in a "threatening tone." We were escorted off the premesis like we were some low-life criminals getting walked back to their cell by a prison guard. Obviously, we took our business elsewhere because they don't deserve a single penny from our wallets. Las Cazuelas, I bet your food tasted like dog crap anyways. Next time, I'd rather celebrate cinco de mayo at Taco Bell than your run down restaurant. Never shall I even have an inkling of a thought to return here, and through multiple means of communication, will relay my horrific experience to hundreds and thousands of people in the Philadelphia area. Thank you for ruining my most treasured holiday and reminding me to wear Kevlar next time I walk into a restaurant in fear of police altercations.

Food was delicious. I ordered takeout today and it was ready in 15 minutes. Tacos and nachos don't always hold up when you get them togo, so I wasn't sure what to expect. When I got home, the food was perfect. Nacho chips were still crispy. Shrimp tacos had minimal ingredients but were delicious. Service was friendly. I can't wait to order from here again soon!

Went to Las Cazuelas for an early dinner on Saturday with the kiddos. Wife had a groupon which made it a good deal. We started with the ceviche which was composed of two separate ceviches (one shrimp, one tilapia); beautifully ring molded and plated, cured with lime and mixed with diced tomato, cilantro and onion. Perfectly seasoned, tangy, savory and just plain delicious. This might have been the best ceviche I have ever tasted. We almost ordered another one it was soooo good. The kids had the queso fondido app which our server explained wasn't really a fondue, but just melted oaxaca cheese. The kids loved this dish with the gooey, salty, stringy cheese, mopped up with the fresh tortillas. The stringy cheese was a little difficult to work with but made it fun for the kids.

For my main course I went with the marinated flank steak (arrachera) cooked perfectly medium. I loved the side that came with this dish - some kind of potato "cake": a mix of diced potatos, tomatos and seasonings. I thought I tasted saffron, garlic, maybe some type of ancho paste? I dunno, except that it was all delicious... anyway, it was all molded into a perfect round and plated along side the steak and accompanied with black bean soup - also very good. Wife had the seafood enchiladas which were enchiladas stuffed with fresh crab meat and shrimp, topped with a delicious "seafood" guacamole. Fabulous. I'm not sure how the chef got this delicious guac to taste like seafood but I suspect he combined the crab "mustard" with the avacodo - and man was it good. The kids had chicken quesadillas which they liked and my one daughter had the chicken in mole sauce w/mexican rice and super dark and rich refried beans. I'm generally not a fan of mole as I often find it  too sweet but this one was exceptional; a perfect balance of layered sweet, savory and smoky flavors and just flat out delicious, especially combined with the chicken and those refried beans all in one tasty bite - again maybe the best mole I have ever had. For desert, we shared two pieces of leche cake (one vanilla and one chocolate which was on special). Both were great but I preferred the classic vanilla. 

Our servers were really friendly and everything at Las Cazuelas was great. Some might balk at the prices here but this is definitely a few notches above your average Mexican. There are details in the food preparations here that most people might not notice. And just because you're from California or Texas doesn't mean you know what Mexican food is supposed to taste like. Mexican food cannot be generalized that way since it's a very complex country with many regions and influences. The result is a rich tapestry of cultures and add to that the influences and ingredients we can only get here in the northeast. Simply put, the food at Las Cazuelas is excellent and I highly recommend it if you're looking for a little something more than your average taquiera.

I bought a groupon from here and tried it for the first time a couple of weeks ago. You won't find just your ordinary nachos and tacos dip here. Their dishes are authentic and amazing. It's also BYOB, so that makes this place AWEsome in my book. Definitely will be back!!

Loving Las Cazuelas...Whenever I have someone in town looking for good Mexican this is our goto place!  I love the atmosphere, the BYOB, and the food...MOST of all, the Tres Leches Cake...It's not even chocolate, but I LOVE IT!  

I was introduced to this place in a dinner group...every 3rd saturday we would goto anther BYOB to check out a new place.  This was one of my favorite finds!  

Altho it is a bit cramped with the tables, its generally not to crowded.  They also have an upstairs section which is where our group of 12 sat.  The food here is quite authentic...Its been a long time since I've been to Mexico, but this place brings back the memories!   The decor is nice, the service is excellent, and the food is the bomb.  It may be a bit pricey compared to Qdoba, but its really quite tasty and worth the drive into the city and the $$$.

Try to park on Girard, this isn't an area you want to be wandering around in!

Fun fact I've actually had this draft sitting in my yelp feed for over a year.

We came here the last two years as a big party for NYE dinner. It was actually excellent accommodations both times for such a large party. In all, my friends all really liked it (and liked it so much we came back this year!) 

The run down:
Elote - have had better
Al Pastor Tacos - was not a fan
Shrimp Tacos - very good
Queso - good but why do they serve them with tortillas instead of chips? 
Guac - a staple

The servers - very nice, plus it's BYO. However, we're almost certain they were using our tequila bottle for someone else's pitcher. A brand new, never opened bottle was returned to us after one pitcher (6 medium sized margs) 2/3rds empty.

Omg super cute in here!! Wanted a cute Mexican place and loved the idea of BYOT. They were out of the margarita mix I wanted so went with the regular which was fine. Had the guacamole and enchiladas- both were great! Nothing over the top but was good solid mexican food. Great for a date or group of friends.

I live a couple blocks away and had always wanted to try here for past 2 years, my boyfriend decided to surprise me and made a resy here and we both were so surprised with how good this neighborhood spot was! The nachos are killer (def order them) and their pre mixed margarita was our favorite (we brought our own tequila). We ordered tacos and my boyfriend was nice enough to let us indulge even further with churros haha! It's nice to know I have this place so close to my home and will def be back!

Me and my girlfriend went here tonight after buying a groupon. Our waiter Sam was phenomenal, he had amazing recommendations and knew all the specials by heart. The food was great, I loved the flan. It made for a fabulous romantic date. It's also byob, which I love. I will definitely go here again.

We just ordered from here thru grub hub. Their guacamole is incredible and the tortillas were homemade. The plattano yuccateco was also delicious. Will def be ordering from here again. The delivery was fast and the food was hot.  Every thing was authentic and delicious!!

I came here for lunch the week after I got back from my most recent trip in Mexico, so maybe I'm a little biased.  Or maybe I'm temporarily a better judge than most gringos.  Bottom line:  the menu sounds far more interesting than the food actually is, and the prices are more than a little too much for what you get. 

The front of the menu says that the restaurant serves specialties from Puebla, but besides Mole Poblano, there was nothing else that jumped out to me as distinctly Pueblan.  Instead, the menu has quite a few regional specialties from other parts of the country (e.g. Cochinita Pibil from the Yucatan, some dishes from the north, etc.). 

The interesting variety on the menu unfortunately didn't translate to a whole lot of interest on our plates. We ordered a pitcher of pineapple juice, which was solid. Then sopositas--the fried masa cakes were crispy and hot.  Thumbs up. The guacamole was essentially just a pile of avocado chunks, without much of anything else. If you like straight, unadorned avocado (I do) this was fine, though we'd sort of hoped for more flavors. 

I ordered a chile relleno as a main course. The chile was just fine, but both the tomato sauce and the black beans and rice that came with the dish were one-dimensional--no spices as far as I could tell, no depth of flavor to speak of.  I will also say that the portions were very modest--a small pool of beans and a tiny little mound of rice. For $16, I would expect either more-than-mediocre flavors, or just more food--but I got neither.  That's enough to make me feel like the dish really came up short. 

Anyway, I would consider coming back to try other things on the menu, some of which you really don't find at too many other Mexican places around here. But I'd only go back with lowered expectations, and if I felt like I had money to burn. Which isn't often.

Seriously was excited to try out a new Mexican spot closer to my house than Cafe Ynez. Disappointed doesn't begin to cut it. The nachos were the best thing we had and that's not saying much. The meat was all dry, the fajitas were just ok, the waitress was inattentive and it wasn't that busy for her level of ineptitude. The saving grace was that she noticed that I hated the tacos ilegales and she reordered them made the way I had expected them to come the first time. Separately the meats were moist and hot and good. Together, well refer to my previous comment on the meat. Long story short... we won't be back and I'm pissed at my SIL for suggesting it was anywhere near edible. Also, their mixer and accompanying items for making drinks are practically nonexistent when it comes to making anything other the cheap drink mix margaritas.

Adorable restaurant tucked away in a part of town (Old Kensington) that was a nice escape from Center City. The surrounding area was a little old, a little random, but I was happy to see the cheerily painted brick storefront of Las Cazuelas sitting on its street-corner spot.

The ambience inside was really warm and pleasant with a diverse crowd that I think spoke to the restaurant's cozy appeal. There was a cute young couple celebrating the guy's birthday over a bottle of Jose Cuervo (it's BYO), a tipsy Spanish-speaking threesome enjoying what looked to be a tasty appetizer sampler, the Antojitos Rancheros, and drinks, a family with their young baby munching on chips and salsa while his parents sipped on margaritas (apparently they'll make em for you), and 2 girls catching up after work.

On to the food. I ordered the Arroz con Pollo and it was sooo delicious! The chicken was really tasty, the rice perfectly moist, and the fresh chunks of avocados on top sealed the deal. The side of black bean soup contrasted nicely with the flavorful entree. The serving size was more than plentiful. My boyfriend ordered the Carne Asada which was pretty good but I've had better (hence 4 stars). That said, he still finished it with a smile on his face :)

Service was good, although we did have to ask our waiter quite awhile after ordering for some chips and salsa. Otherwise everything came out promptly and our waiter was very courteous. 

Will be back!

While I love all Mexican food, this place is a nice change of pace from most Mexican restaurants you find in the city.  Instead of just ordering some tacos, burritos, or fajitas, Las Cazuelas is serving what feels like homemade Mexican food.  Basic, clean, and very delicious.

The restaurant itself is pretty small, so it's ideal for small parties.  The service is friendly and the food is great.  I would recommend it to anyone.
Hubby brought me here for my birthday.  Had an absolutely wonderful time.  The food was awesome & so was the ambiance!

Ordered the guac, gringos tacos, and fish tacos & was impressed by all 3! Tacos are great bang for your buck. Portions are large and they're all around $10! 
The fish tacos were amazing and the chipotle mayo was really smokey and delicious. Not too spicy either!
You get complimentary chips and green salsa with your meal. The restaurant is a bit small inside but there is also outdoor street seating. Excited to come back and try more foods!
Ordered delivery via GrubHub- "Nachitos" (no jalapeños) and "Pastor Taquito". I ordered around 6:30pm, and food was at my door by 6:50! Everything was incredible and cannot wait to order again soon!
Delicious food, expedient and friendly service. Horchata was excellent. Great place for authentic Mexican food
Nice place! Great food! Our server was wonderful.. BYOB was nice, too. Will definitely go again..
Everything was delicious and the staff was very nice but the lighting was horrendous and flickering nonstop so as long as thats fixed id give 5 stars!

bring your own tequila... what more do you need in life? the marg flavors here are great, my personal favorite sunrise! the tacos here though you need to be selective. we got a mixture and i have to say tilapia is the best one. any of the beef ones were very very dry and chewy, i ended up spitting those out. i would definitely be willing to come back to try out their other dishes and more margarita pitchers

This place is AMAZING!!!  Best Mexican food east of Texas.  I've eaten here for lunch several times and have had attentive service and unbelievably tasty food. Their mole is authentic and delicious. I've never eaten here for dinner, but I just might one of these days when I get a chance

Ole!

The most half a**ed burrito I've ever had in my life. Aside from the fact that you have to pay extra to put meat inside of a burrito..... it arrived to me unwrapped so I busted out my own burrito wrapping skills. Tomato "salsa" was also just blended tomato with water. Still ate it though.  0/10. It straight up had corn, that should tell u enough.

This  food was the worst I've ever had in Philly. It had no taste and the food was cold. Additionally, they didn't get the order right! When I called the non-customer service person who answered the phone argued with me that it was correct.  Stay away unless you want a horrible experience.

I have been here and got chicken quesadilla. I was told this was the best Mexican place in town and don't get me wrong their food is not bad. But to be honest I didn't think the food was great. I think Dos Segundos and some time even Los Caminos Real serve better food

We went here for a casual dinner on a Tuesday.  The place was empty and the service was top notch.  Tuesday also happened to have a Prix Fixe menu option.  Everything was delicious. For $40 we got a tortilla soup, chicken tostada, shrimp and rice, a huge pile of beef and 2 tres leches cakes. 

I'm not sure what another reviewer was talking about, we got chips and salsa for free, the waitress even brought us salt and limes for our BYO-Beer.

The food is incredible, but they don't like to be held accountable for when they've made mistakes for missing items from their delivered orders. After we ordered food, over $100 for an entire family, they were missing two items from the order and when we called to confirm that it wasn't in the bag, we were shot back at with a horrible attitude and they requested that we never order from there again.

We frequently ordered from them because we absolutely love the food, but their behavior after simply asking about a couple of items was inexcusable. We want to support local restaurants right now, but the fact that they no longer want us to place orders for them just because we asked about a missing item is very childish.

I would think twice about ordering through GrubHub - the drivers cannot open the bags to check the items to stay sanitary, so it wasn't the fault of the driver, but the restaurant.

I was visiting Philly with a few friends and we decided to try Las Cazuelas. The restaurant wasn't in the heart of the city and it took a few minutes to drive to its location, but it was worth it! 

Las Cazuelas is a small restaurant on the corner. It's BYOB, so we brought our own bottle. We redeemed the free pitcher of margarita for checking into Yelp and they kindly blended the margaritas for us. I split different tacos with my friends so I tried the cactus stem taco and carne asada taco. Both were delicious!!!!! The corn was also sweet and juicy. It seemed that our waiter was training and although he came back several times to verify our order, he was very kind and made sure we were taken care of. 

The restaurant was a little out of the way but definitely worth a visit!
So good.  Flavor-full.  Great service.  Cheesecake bunuelo is amazing.  Eat your dinner here first,  though and then that Cheesecake wonder.  It is BYOB,  just FYI

I'll give this spot another chance but the burritos I got from here were barely wrapped (super loose, rectangle instead of tube) and dripped so much juice that it formed a puddle in my takeout box. Had to eat it with a fork and knife because I couldn't really pick it up.
Got the mahi mahi tacos. The fish tasted weird and they were was no mango in their "mango salsa". Probably won't return.
This was my first time here. The serve was excellent and the food was delicious.  My daughter had Shrimp tacos and I had Camarones Chipotle.  We'll definitely be back to try other items soon.

It was really just ok. Honestly, I don't understand why places charge $2.75 for an authentic Mexican taco. I little spatter of chicken inside some corn tortillas? I know this isn't just at this restaurant, it's all over but it's really stupid! And $6 for a side order of rice and beans at lunch time? I feel really ripped off. We won't be back. Also, with an open kitchen, I strongly suggest that all kitchen staff dress in chef wear. One guy was wearing a scummy t-shirt. It just doesn't look good to customers dining. Know what I mean?

My expectations may have been too high with all of the awards on the wall (of course, they were all pretty old.)

The best authentic Mexican food in Philly hands down! I had the pleasure of sitting down with the owner, Alfredo! Check out the interview below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ndMMJrW5EUc

We went to celebrate a birthday, and we had a very good experience.  We were allowed to bring our own cake. The food was delicious, fresh and well made.  The servings were good sized, not huge, not tiny.  Two people in our party are vegetarian, and there were several options for them too.  The prices were reasonable. Service was excellent too.  Overall, it was a great experience.
Marcela P.

I went here for a friend's birthday party. We were a large party and they put us in the smaller room through the kitchen. 

Food was good, if a little pricey. They provided margarita pitchers which when split between all of us were quite cheap and really good. They put up with us being noisy, singing to our friend and taking a few tequila shots quite nicely. I especially appreciated that they had to come in and out of our room to run the cash register, and while doing so were consistently helpful, sweet and quick to refill waters and chips/salsa.

They wouldn't split the check on more than three cards, which is the only reason I've taken off a star; I do understand how obnoxious that is, but it makes it very hard to eat out in large groups at a restaurant, especially when it's a friend's party where you don't know everybody else (so you can't just pay your close friend back later).

Thanks for hosting us! I would definitely come back.

Like a dog with a bone I can't let go of my search for the perfect Al Pastor Taco and exploring all these new options on my routes to and from work has given me ample opportunity to do so. 

Todays review is for Las Cazuelas.  I read alot of the other reviews which were kind of hit or miss experiences but I figured why not. 

I found the price tag to be a little steep. Thirteen dollars for three tacos is just short of 5.00 per taco. At least I found the tacos to be generously filled AND there were no extra sauteed onions mixed in the filling, hooray!!!  Just the pork and the pineapple topped with cilantro and raw onion. They didn't throw in those extra little garnishes like the fried jalapeno and the giant scallion thing with the large bulb on the end, not even a damn radish. I missed the jalapeno. I like to cut it up for an extra spicy kick but their salsa which was thicker and hotter than most I've had with this dish, made up for that. As for taste, they were okay. I've had much better at Distrito (who took them off the menu) and Rivera Taco (I left the state of DE)

There was a lady at the table next to me who raved about their crab enchiladas. She made me promise to try them next and I did on my next visit. I don't usually go for enchiladas. I love the way a griddled or fried tortilla taste and I hate how they get soggy and fall apart in the enchilada style but I did get them. The menu on the window outside said the cost was 20.00 but I was charged 23.00. You get 3 enchiladas covered in a green mole sauce and sprinkled with cheese and red onions ( I took those off ). The sides consisted of veggies that were uninspired julienned strips of squash and boring basic white rice. I would have preferred traditional Mexican rice and black beans to be honest. The filling in this dish was crab (definately canned) and shrimp (definately frozen) but it tasted okay. Not worth the price  I wouldn't get it again and I don't know why the lady who recommended this dish was so into it.

*SPOILER ALERT- THEY HAVE THE BEST EMPANADAS I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE*

Headed to Philly to hang out with some friends and I just had to check out groupons over there. I ended up finding a voucher for this place and I've got to say: if this is what Philly has to offer I want in!

Came here on a Friday night--no reservations, and felt lucky since there were only 2-3 tables that were left open. Appreciated the homie, Mexican feel to the place, definitely reminded me of when I was in the old school town of Mexico. We were led to the upstairs area--which at the time I was hosted a party of 10 of the loudest 20-something year olds celebrating a birthday. We were ok with the deafening noise since we've experienced crazy nights like them before.

Mentioned that I had a group-on to whoever sat us down, and she didn't bat an eye lash or stop smiling (so group-on friendly unlike many other places Ive been to). Server came to us immediately with water, chips/salsa and a smile. She remained very attentive during the night even with the amount of tables she had upstairs. (she was a 5 star gem).

We ordered empanadas, the steak tacos for apps and for entrees Mole Poblano Chicken and the Abuelitas Chicken dish.

-Empanadas were seriously the best I've ever had. The golden outside crust was made to perfection, not oily and greasy, and the chicken inside was seasoned well plus was made with Chipotle sauce. Only two pieces given so share wisely.
-Steak tacos were also very good, flavorful and tender
-Mole Pobano--that Mole sauce would make you smack your mamma twice and ask why she never made you Mole sauced chicken. AMAZING.
-Abuelitas-I bought it because in the menu it talked about the deceased mother's signature dish. It was a tear jerker so I wanted to honor Abuelita Cazuela. It was good but not AH MAZING, only because the chicken breast was a little dry even with the sauce. But the rice and beans were so good.

THIS IS A BYOB. So we did and we were provided with a cup of ice to add to our drinks.

-Bill came up to $50, $13 group-on knocked off $25, so balance was $25. I enjoyed our waitress so much that I tipped her really well. (I heard her accommodate another party by moving them downstairs after they mentioned how loud that party was). If i'm in Philly again I will come back.

This was a highly recommended place. Was there bout an hour ago. Had a nice but clueless waitress.  That was the beginning of the horrible experience. 
The food was not good at all. Ordered the Appetizer stuffed plantain which was ok.  Probably the best thing we had. I ordered the house special burrito and it was very bland. My wife ordered the carne gisada and it had zero flavor. I was very disappointed being Latino and being used to flavor filled food this place was a waste of my 50.00 dollars.   I had to ask for napkins , ask for ice for my room temp sodas and finally had to ask 3 times for a check.  Combined service and tasteless food I will never go back. Needless to say, I believe the he'd chef or manager was there and observed the whole thing.  The are is all new and seems the attitude is still present.   La Casuelas needs to have a better chef and better staff.   Save your money.

5 stars for the service. Our server was amazing and took good care of us. 
5 stars for tres leche as well. Big portion, can be shared between two people.
The food itself was alright. We ordered chicken empanadas which was okaish and I found it a little oily, fish taco was really good specially with the house made sauce on it, chilli rellenos was okaish too. Although the quantity for everything was good. 
Its BYOB. And if you checkin on yelp get free margarita mix so don't forget to take your tequilla!!!

I was here on Saturday night with a large group. They put us in the back room next to the kitchen which is a good room for 10 to 20 people.

Our waitress quickly brought us a pitcher of tequila mix. I wasn't planning on drinking the tequila mix and asked if she can bring water for everyone. After 10 to 15 of still no water I asked again and was told there was a glass shortage so they couldn't accommodate water for everyone. I handed them my empty glass and asked the server to fill with water. Strike 1 for no water. There should be no excuse for a restaurant to not at least be able to offer water to everyone. Yes it may be a busy night but purchase more glasses if you run short on busy nights.

My boyfriend ordered the chicken mole enchiladas and I ordered the shrimp entree with rice and vegetables.

The entrees all ran $15 to $18. The mole sauce was gross. My boyfriend will eat anything even cold hot dogs so for him to not like something there  is a problem. The mole sauce was thick and hard to eat. Maybe they used too much chocolate or nuts as I couldn't taste any spices, not that I could taste much of anything in it.

My shrimp was very average. There was little spice on it and I ordered hot sauce or something spicy on the side. They brought me hot peppers which I loaded into mg entree.

The chips were fine but both the Verde and red sauces were not spicy and pretty balance.

On a good note, they do take credit card and decor was nice.

Food was less than average and there's much better Mexican in Philly.

Ordered tacos. The guacamole was good but the portion was bit small for a group of 4. Wished I could have had choices for the tacos but you can only order option. If you bring your own mix of alcohol, they will make margarita for you.

Don't sit upstairs when it is hot outside because it's so much hotter up there! 

The restaurant looks much smaller when you first walk inside but it has the upstairs area and another room for bigger parties. The kitchen is open and you can see them cooking. The staff is very attentive, the guy we had was funny when I tried pronouncing my meal. I like that they have a vegetarian part on the menu (duh!); I ordered the Rajas Poblana. I'm a little surprised it comes with white rice and not a Mexican rice, my only complaint. The food was delicious! Seitan is a hard thing to make delicious especially getting the texture correct and it was GOOD. Our entire party loved the food, some of the guys realized getting the fish tacos is a small portion (only 2) so if you're hungry order the corn on the cob!

BYOB.
You can order margarita mix for $7 or check-in on Yelp and get one free!! I heard it tastes really good but it is sweet so add some water to dilute it. Really good food and nice people, I would definitely try this place! Not too expensive either. You can also call to make reservations, we had a party of 7 so it was a good idea for us!

A cute and convenient place to grab dinner. I love that they are BYOB, and their enchiladas and empanadas are really good. The burrito my boyfriend got was the biggest I've ever seen, and tasted awesome. It can feel a little cramped inside, but we've always had good service and a delicious meal. Definitely one of my favorite places for Mexican!

I was stuck between a 2 and 3 stars but I don't want to be too mean. In summary, this was an OVER PRICED and LACKLUSTER meal. 

My boyfriend and I made a spontaneous decision to go here for dinner on a Tuesday night since he came here once and wanted me to try it. Our favorite Mexican food staple is Taco Riendo a couple blocks down from here. This restaurant is very small, less than 10 tables and about 3 are near the door, then the closest table is about 10ft from the kitchen. It's a cozy little restaurant with dark lightning but definitely not a classy vibe. Btw it's BYOB. 

The waitress was very nice and kept checking up on us, service wasn't bad although she was a bit antsy and awkward with conversation lol. Food came out fast, but we were one of two tables there, and the other table already got their food, so I can't really judge on how fast they'll be if they're Busier. Here's where everything goes downhill.
 
The table came with free chips and salsa to dip. However, I didn't enjoy the chips at all. They were way too crispy, thin, and had absolutely no flavor, tasted stale almost. I felt as if I was biting on shards. I was very disappointed and waited for the chips that came with the $9 guacamole hoping it'll be better. To my surprise, the guacamole came out ALONE, probably about 6-7 spoonfuls of guac and NO chips. $9!!!!!! Ok at this point I'm expecting banging guac and honestly, this was also very mediocre. I've had better packaged guac from Trader Joe's -.- we also decided to share one Mexican corn, which was $5.5 for a small one. The Mexican corn was mostly sweet, there wasn't really the spicy, sweet, and sour kick I was looking for. At half the price at Taco Riendo, you get a bigger corn that tastes way better!

I am a sucker for platters and I decided on the pork shoulder platter which came with a handful of pork (shredded, and super soft), re fried beans, a tiny bit of rice, and half a plantain. I loved the plantain, but it was so small, there was soooo much meat compared to the rice and the meat was a little too salty to be eating alone. There was like 3 bites of rice before it was gone. $17. Would I get it again? Probably not. Unproportional, overpriced, and mediocre food.

My bf got the beef tacos and the al pastor tacos; tacos are probably the only thing on the menu that isn't overpriced. However, the taste of these tacos were also mediocre at best, nothing really stood out about them. The sauces weren't good, meat wasn't too flavorful, and the condiments didn't help. 

Our total was almost $60 and a good way to put it is that meal did not "hit the spot." I was left feeling empty inside although I was so full. Maybe they were having an off day in the kitchen but the food was so bad. Won't be back :(
Service was super quick and margaritas were made the way I asked! Bonus that it's a byob so you can bring your own tequila. Food was delicious.

Came here for a late lunch with a local friend. Had chicken mole, black bean soup, street corn, taco thingies. Everything was great 

Place is brick and cozy inside. You can see the flames from the grill

Went here for a late Valentine's Day dinner. Worst service I have ever experienced. They seemed surprised that they were busy on a Saturday night. They clearly skimped on the number of chips that they gave us as an appetizer. There was more air in our salsa dish than actual salsa. Our appetizer (nachos) came out in the middle of dinner and was lackluster in appearance; it looked like something a 5 year old could make in their microwave. We waited 15 minutes for our margaritas because they somehow ran out of ice and had to send someone to purchase some. We thought it would be a great idea bringing our own tequila to put into their margarita mix, but when we finally got our drinks it was more like tequila on the rocks than a margarita. It was like they were trying to make us drink enough so we wouldn't remember the horrendous service that they were providing. Unfortunately, it didn't work. 

This brings me to the food, which was average at best. It was somewhere between Taco Bell and Chipotle in quality and taste. The sides that were supposed to come with our tacos and burritos never came. Once our meal was over, the waitstaff tried to force us out of the restaurant without giving us our leftover tequila or allowing us time to enjoy the remainder of our tequila lime juice mix. Overall, I would not go back to this restaurant. The silver-lining to the night was that it wasn't too expensive.

Was in the mood for tacos and elote and found this gem. 
We originally intended on going somewhere else but were unable to get reservations. We made reservations and upon arriving was seated immediately, with the option for indoor or outdoor. Took a chance and sat outside and luckily was not bothered by bugs. 

Everything that came out was fresh and tasty. Idk what was on the tostones but it was tasty and had a bit of a kick to it. The elote was amazing, the corn was sweet, not mushy and the right amount of seasoning. I've been places and have have everything coming off the elote. I really enjoyed my tacos. I really like Mexican style tacos, cilantro and onions I love and you can't go wrong with that. 

As we were eating it appeared that they were preparing to close as they were bringing tables etc from outside, cleaning up and had closed blinds.  But we were never rushed through our meal, in fact our server still offered us dessert despite the fact that we were the only patrons at this restaurant and they were preparing to leave. 

I would definitely return and support this business. Even noticed that they have rooftop seating as we were leaving.

I don't know if it's that I am not the biggest fan of Mexican food or it was just ok. Service and food were good. Would I go back? Yes. Am I in a hurry? Not so much. By checking into yelp you receive a free pitcher of margarita. We chose the pomegranate. It was yummy. Started off with the guacamole and ceviche. For my entree I stuck with a vegetarian dish. Stuff portabella mushroom with melted cheese peppers and their tomato sauce. I'm not a vegetarian, but if you are there is a decent selection to choose from.
Heard good things about this place but it was below mediocre. The food wasn't anything special and the guac was brown. First time and last time going there.

Absolutely FABULOUS!  We've been past Las Cazuelas a million times, but never stopped in.  We often get Groupons to try new restaurants and used our Groupon last night.  Sure glad we did!  The food, service and atmosphere couldn't have been better.  With the first bite, we were hooked.  We will definitely be back - often.

This place is simply amazing. I was looking for a BYO that could accommodate a large party of friends prior to my birthday party which was at 6th and Girard. Stumbled upon this place on Yelp and was able to make a reservation online. I made a reservation for 18 (!!) people the night prior to the dinner and they totally made it work for us (I did call to confirm with the restaurant). There is a semi-private room in the restaurant but for our party of 18 the room was ours. The food from the appetizers to the desserts were phenomenal. I highly recommend the nachos and the shrimp tacos (taquitos). My boyfriend got the carnitas tacos which were also really tasty. The margaritas were also so good and I recommend the jalapeño mix. I can't say enough good things about this place. If it's any indication of how great it is - two weeks later we came back and ran into another group of our friends who had also been here the first night we came, we couldn't get enough!

The sopas appetizer was good. The soup that was the special was special-priced but was a thin tomato/hot -sauce flavored broth with a flat flavor, Oaxaca cheese, tortilla strips, and Avocado.

I didn't taste it, but My friend didn't rave about his Mole. My pork chop tasted a lot like a Sazon rubbed pork chop.

The atmosphere is very nice and the service is good; our waiter spoke Spanish (which as you know dosn't happen often in phila Mexican restaurants). This could be a nice date place and it is close enough to northern liberties to make it a neighborhood Mexican place if you live there.

Veggies: they were willing to make anything (within reason) without meat for vegetarians.

I have been to las cazuelas a few times and it is def one of the more authentic Mexican places! The inside is very small but cozy and they have outdoor seating which is always a plus.  The first time I came here I got the appetizer sampler and chile relleno and they were just ok.  It wasn't till the next time that I realized how good this place is! Their arroz con pollo is amazing and one of the best dishes I've ever had! Their mole enchiladas r pretty good too w some of the best mole I've ever had!  
I love that this place is byot and their marg mixes r good esp the classic!

I didn't give this place 5 stars cuz the service can be bad sometimes depending on which server u get and for the so- so food on my first visit.

Oh and by the way, check out groupon, they have deals for this place from time to time!

I went the other day with my wife for dinner. The service was friendly and food quality was pretty good, but there was a fruit fly infestation that made this one of the worst dinner experiences I've had dining out. I killed at least 5 flies and they just kept coming. I should have walked out after I squished 2 and 2 more popped up, but I was having a rare dinner out with my wife and wanted to enjoy it. But it was too much. There were flies in my food, my beer, on the walls. The thought of these flies transferring bacteria from the drains and trash into my food and drink made my stomach turn. I had to leave. 

Before I left, I told the server about the flies and he acknowledged that it was a problem he was aware of but the back of house was unwilling to resolve it. He promised to tell the manager/boss when he or she came in later. If they knew the fly infestation was a problem and have not done everything in their power to fix it, I will never come back. If the flies are visible to patrons and nothing is done about it, what about the stuff you can't see?? No thanks, I'm never going back and would recommend you not as well.

This is my second time coming here. The first time was fine, but I order a platter that cost $26 to go. The food I received wasn't worth it. It was more so a plate for a child than doe a human.  I got the steak, but very little rice & no refried beans. When I called to say that my order didn't have beans and very little rice (less than a quarter cup), they said that's how the food came and if I wanted what I ordered I had to pay an extra $7.50 on top of the $28 I spent (including tax). I wouldn't go back. Even though I showed them the food and called, they didn't try to mend the situation. So now I'm out $28 when o could've ordered UberEats from a different place for the same price with better/more food. 

For reference I only ate a piece of the steak. Everything else was untouched (the exact size of rice the food came with). For the amount of food I got, this should've been $15-$17, but not $26. This whole experience was just awful and a waste. They need to be responsible and fix the issues that their customers being to their attention.

This is my absolute favorite Mexican restaurant in Philadelphia.  The food is tastefully done, flavorful, and delicious.  My personal favorites are elode asado and the shrimp tacos.  Every now and then I'll have the tres leches.  It is also a byob if you chose to eat there!  You can also takeout.  The only downside is that the seats are pretty sketchy (dirty looking) and don't represent the restaurant very well.

We went here because we had a groupon. It's was a small place on girard decorated to make you feel like you weren't in Philly anymore. 
We started with an appetizer sampler. It was okay. I wish the meats were marinated, or there was some sauce because it seemed a little bland. 
I also had the arroz con pollo. This dish was delicious. Super flavorful and big portions. 
The waitress had to take care of the whole restaurant. Poor girl was running around the whole night, so we sometimes didn't have water. 
Overall it was a good experience in a family run restaurant. Worth going to once especially if you have the groupon.

Came in here and the vibe was immediately comfortable and had a cute style. The food was amazing and the presentation was superb, the dishes overall looked extremely appetizing. We shared the fiesta platter, which included a variety of empanadas, nachos, and flautas and it was a perfect size. The carne asada tacos, served with cilantro and onions, were extremely delicious and also pretty filling. I would also recommend the desserts, the churros and tres leches were excellent. Our server, Shadi, was super personable and seemed to know the menu very well and gave great recommendations, and made our overall experience there pleasant and I would definitely go back!

My first time at la cazuelas I must say the time spent there was absolutely pleasurable, from the food to the service. It was very inviting and cozy, the music want too loud that you had to talk over the music. I was seated promptly by my waitress Carolynn she attend us quickly and was very attentive the food came out veryquickly and waitress checked in on us constantly. The  food was delicious although I stood wanting more to be honest I wish more would of came with my serving but overall I was happy. 

I'd recommend la cazuelas to anyone I know that's looking to eat good food and get equally good service.

I have been to Las Cazuelas three or four times and have yet to be disappointed. Whether I am sitting upstairs or down, there for dinner or brunch, the food is always great and the service is always excellent. It is BYOB and you can bring liquor and they will make the mixed drinks for you, which is really cool.

I have tried a few different items on the menu and here are some highlights; Antojitos Rancheros, the appetizr platter which is large enough to have for a meal and provides a nice selection of items; Mole Poblano; Banana Crepes; Vanilla Tres Leches; Huevos Rancheros; and the Pan A La Francesa.

Also, they are always on Groupon and LivingSocial, so check out the deals, but be sure to tip you waitstaff well because they do an excellent job.

This is the perfect spot for a friends get-together or date night. I went with 3 other girlfriends and the byo margs were great! We split the Queso Fundido with chorizo- it was super creamy and the chorizo was chopped finely which made it blend easily and it wasn't too salty which I find happens often with chorizo. 

I got the carnitas tacos (no cilantro) an they were juicy and had crispiness as well and was great with fresh onion and lime. If you are not a big fan of cilantro, my friends had tacos with it on, and they do add a lot! 

Finished the night off with some churros and it was perfect!!

My boyfriend [Mexican] and I [not] absolutely love the Mole Poblano on the menu.  It is by far the best mole we've had in Philly.  All the other dishes are great too.

Our only complaint is that it looks like this once hole-in-the-wall unknown restaurant is gaining ground and doesn't know how to handle the surge of patrons.  We took my brother and his g/f there, hailing it as the best mexican in the city, and then we had to wait 20 min for our reservation and got our water in coffee mugs because they ran out of glasses.  

So the food is great and really fairly priced, but be prepared, that if it's busy, service suffers.

So I did try las cazuelas, it's a byob Mexican restaurant in Fishtown. I typically go to Sancho pistolas but they were closed for covid and this place is byob! Very small place, you can see into the kitchen and the service was the kindest. She was so helpful with menu suggestions and gearing me away from my indecisiveness. The tostada was really good, but it could've used more sauce to liven it up a bit but still decent. Listen I really wanted to get tacos but she hyped up the pork dish and my friend thankfully got tacos so I was able to try both. Let me tell you the real winner winner pork dinner here is their Cochinita Pibil. The flavor in this dish is unbelievable. You can def tell they took their time and this recipe has been in someone's familia for generations. The tacos were just ok, not as great as sancho pistol-as. However, try the pibil , bring a drink and enjoy being treated like your at the family table. I would go back here for the service and the menu is pretty vast with a lot of home style items. Tacos and void in the tostada aside, it's worth trying out at least once 3.5 out of 5

Had a $25 gift card for this BYO spot so we decided to give it a try. Purchased the guacamole appetizer which was a small portion. It tasted nice, but i wished it was bigger in size. The appetizer nachos with chicken were the nights hit. These bad boys were piled mile high and loaded with cheese, beans, sour cream and guac. I could have just eaten the nachos, but being the true fatty I am we all ordered tacos too lol. The table had two orders of the al pastor tacos and I got the shrimp tacos. Everyone shared. Overall the tacos were a solid 3.5/5. My only complaint was that the shells were too soft so the tacos kept falling apart. 

I do love that this is a BYO spot. It adds to its charm. Most people order to-go orders. During our time here there was only one other table sitting inside.

Confession, I walked past this place EVERYDAY during high school and now almost 10 years after graduating did I finally come here. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant is very homey and laid back. Perfect for the drizzly evening my friend and I met up here. The staff was friendly and helpful (thanks for not putting the onions on my tacos!!). They also didn't rush us out once we were done our food. 

I inhaled my carnitas tacos as soon as they were in front of me (hence no pictures for this review). They had great flavor and left me feeling satisfied. Have to say the only thing that I was kinda bummed by was the amount of guacamole given for $9. Not sure why my three tacos cost less than a small serving of guac... but the guac was still good!

I was looking for authentic Mexican food and came across this place... It's small and cozy, but the food was great. 
The only thing that bothered me was the service... The waitress asked if I was using a Groupon and she seemed relieved thatI wasn't. If you don't wanna honor it, why offer? That was the only turn off... Other than that, my husband and I enjoyed the meal.

I had high hopes for this place based on the good reviews. However, the food was very meh and things got way worse after I finished my meal and went home.

I came with a friend for lunch. We split an order of the carnitas nachos. I ordered the tacos illegales and my friend ordered the chicken enchiladas with mole sauce. The carnitas nachos were really good: covered in cheese and pico de gallo, with a healthy serving of great marinated pork. My tacos (with steak, chicken and chorizo) were unimpressive. The only meat that stood out was the chorizo; the steak and chicken were pretty bland and forgettable. Also, they only use one tortilla for each taco, so grease was seeping through and dripping all over my hands by the time I got to my third taco.

This is where things get gross: an hour or two after eating, I felt shooting pains in my gut. I immediately had to rush home to the bathroom and experienced a bad case of the runs. I didn't eat anything prior to lunch besides two waffles. Still, unsure if it was for sure the food that made me poop my brains out, I consulted with my friend. He too had gone through the same experience after I dropped him off.

Point is, don't come here unless you're looking for unexciting Mexican food that might leave you running for the toilet a couple hours after your meal.

Las Cazuelas, you had me at BYOB.
Being a Chicana from LA, I was like - WHA?  Mexican food in Philly, this can't be good.  And then I was like, "You bring the tequila and they make margaritas for you?" So I turned my frown upside down and kept an open mind. 
Las Cazuelas was a nice surprise for this street taco snob...Not only is this place fun and kitchy, the food and drinks are really good....I mean, mole poblano is not always good, or even decent, but at Las Cazuelas, it was good!  So were the very crisp chips, and the perfectly ripened and seasoned guacamole.  Wow!  Impressed.
What was probably the MOST impressive at Las Cazuelas was the service.  We had really nice and attentive staff that kept our group of 22+ happy.  I wish I remembered our main servers name (young, tall, beard) because he was so professional and enthusiastic.  He was on point the whole night, and that was not easy to do.  
Overall, a solid, casual and fun place with good food and you BYOB...what's not to like?
Found this little gem on the way to a concert at union transfer. Shared two orders of tacos shrimp and talapia.  Fresh and delicious.  Definitely worth a drive.

I could not find a dang negative thing to say about this place if I tried! 

Came in on a Tuesday evening at about 7:30 pm to a packed house- luckily we were able to be seated at the last remaining table. The space is small, dark, and intimate- perfect for a date night, not so great for a group dinner.

Our waitress was so sweet and accommodating, & happily gave us extra chips and salsa and tortillas when we ran out. She also expertly mixed the tequila we brought with their homemade margarita mix.

Two of us shared chorizo queso fundido, nachitos and steak fajitas. Loved it all. The queso fundido was SO good- just make sure to eat it all before it cools down. Love that the fajitas come with rice and beans, also. 

We were able to use a Groupon and get out of there for under 20 bucks, including tip. Would highly recommend and will definitely return, with or without a Groupon!
Horrible service. Ran out of food. Waited 2hours only to be told they could not seat us. I'd rather go to Taco Bell.

Fantastic food!  The Ensalada La Condensa was amazing and our dinners were both delicious.  My husband had the Enchiladas de Cangrejo y Camaron and I enjoyed a vegetarian option, Rajas de Puebla.

The servers were very courteous and the food came quickly.

BYOB, so bring your cerveza or vino!
 
We will definitely be back.

We came with a group of friends and had a blast! The food was great and the margarita mixes were good too! The table favorite was tropical sunrise, and our waitress was very nice. We will definitely be back

Thankfully I had a discounted Groupon because Tamar B and I will not be returning here for anything. Yikes!

We wanted to grab dinner before a Yelp Event so I purchased a Groupon and came here. I would have been really pissed had I paid "real" money for the sham of a taco they served. 

First, the restaurant is extremely small. Probably about 12 tables total and super close together. Usually small means intimate but its small and very loud. So small that you almost knock a table over that's sitting close to the entrance. However, they do have outside seating. 

We ordered a guacamole and two orders of Cancun Tacos which were made with tilapia, chipotle mayo, pickled onions and cilantro. 

The guacamole was $9!!!! We ate about 3 chips apiece and it was gone. The portion was very small and needed to be salted. Plain and just overall blah. For nine smackers, I want a bowl not a couple of spoonfuls. Ugh. 

The tacos took about a half hour to get to the table. The fish was overcooked, had a microwaved taste to it. Almost as if it were yesterdays fish and someone reheated it and threw crap on them. The tacos were soft so with all the goop thrown on top, you had to eat them with a fork. Yuck. Wet and soggy tacos. Disgusting. 

We were asked if we liked everything and we didn't. I tried to finish my plate. Tamar had hers replaced with a $6 ear of Mexican corn . Overpriced in my opinion. I didn't see anything else on the menu that I wanted so I just didn't finish it. 

Bland food, slow service and too small of a restaurant makes an unhappy customer.

Ordered door dash from here and my delivery driver had to wait for almost an hour and a half for the meal to be ready. (It stated that our order would be ready in an hour and he showed up to pickup on time.) I ordered a burrito and a Mexican coke. The coke came 100% warm, (probably was never even refrigerated), and this is by far the greasiest, worst-wrapped burrito I've ever had the displeasure of attempting to eat.

Stopped in for lunch and was happy that I did!! It was a quick in and out. Was worth the wait. The gentleman that took the order was nice.

Ate my food in the car on the go (lol) and it was pretty good! The corn was tasty and flavorful. The shrimp....mmmmmm!!!! It's hard to find a true spot that has authentic Mexican food. Let me tell you something...these shrimp tacos was SO ON POINTTTT!!! The shrimp tacos were fresh, with the fixings and cooked just right!

The place was a bit empty at lunch time but it looked like a cool restaurant to stop in and eat. A lot of people seem to order on an app for their food.

I will definitely be coming back!!!
